commit_message:
Change default target from stable/icehouse to master

As of writing this commit message icehouse has yet to be released so
stable/icehouse doesn't exist.  So make the default values the same as
how we use grenade in gate.

commit_message:
Don't run main() on import

This patch adds the usual __name__ test to the database migration script to
avoid execution of the main() function in case of a module import (which
happens when running the configuration options discovery script from
openstack-doc-tools).

Closes-Bug: #1290708
Change-Id: I863a36bcbbbbb02652a4aae8ec1f383c43b5bc56

[{'created': '2014-02-28 16:55:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix RemoteClient usage in scenario tests

Some scenario tests use the following patter to work with RemoteClient:

   client = self.get_remote_client(ip,
                                   private_key=keypair.private_key)

ssh_client is directly accessed because exec_command method

commit_message:
Fix RemoteClient usage in scenario tests

Some scenario tests use the following patter to work with RemoteClient:

   client = self.get_remote_client(ip,
                                   private_key=keypair.private_key)
   return client.ssh_client

ssh_client is directly accessed because exec_command method
is not directly available in RemoteClient

In order to preserve encapsulation, RemoteClient should be improved to
expose that method.

Change-Id: I054762d769d002b5fb45c871d85a8ca8ff294695
Closes-Bug: #1285539

commit_message:
Fixup region description uniqueness

Add a db migration for relaxing the uniqueness constraint on the
'description' column in the region table.

The migration will only occur if there is a unique index constraint
on the 'description' table. The previous migration of 037 has
had the unique index dropped on table creation. 043 will only be
run in the case of a deployment tracking closer to master than
the official releases.

Related-Bug: 1284972
Change-Id: I8198aec2fea4ff6a88938696499a60ebc0b16a47

Remove giant vmdk from the list of images

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-07 21:24:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable stable interface names on Fedora

By default Fedora cloud images have disabled the
udev rules which give us stable network interface names. While
this is a reasonable default for something like EC2 (the target
for these images) this is very bad behavour on bare metal
and can cause a "musical NICs" situation to occur where
on reboot the NIC names get swapped.

In this commit we re-enable stable interface naming by
removing the dev nulled rules softlink and installing
the biosdevname package. Once this is done interface
names should again show up as em1, em2 instead of
the old eth0, eth1.

Before doing this we'll want to make sure this
fix in tripleo-incubator lands:

  https://review.openstack.org/71998

Otherwise, we'll break seed nodes which are a special case
in this regard.

Change-Id: Idd67977342719e2f295e2fa2c0ed6cfa8602171a

commit_message:
baremetal element: Enable stable interface names

By default most cloud images have disabled the
udev rules which give us stable network interface names. While
this is a reasonable default for something like EC2 (the target
for these images) this is very bad behavour on bare metal
and can cause a "musical NICs" situation to occur where
on reboot the NIC names get swapped.

In this commit we re-enable stable interface naming by
removing the dev nulled rules softlink and installing
the biosdevname package. Once this is done interface
names should again show up as em1, em2 instead of
the old eth0, eth1.

We also remove some the common, statically configured
eth0 config files on some distributions. Equivalent
files (if needed) may be auto-generated by using
the dhcp-all-interfaces element.

Change-Id: Idd67977342719e2f295e2fa2c0ed6cfa8602171a

commit_message:
Get logs of all instance on seed

The attempt to get the undercloud logs no longer worked because the IP
addresses have changed. Instead get logs for all instances on the seed,
now that overcloud is running directly on the seed this will cover all
hosts.

Change-Id: I8a87fb3990020382ab4cfd82c66c02490f1a7faf

commit_message:
db_base_class should call delete_port instead of _delete_port

When a network is deleted the db_base_class currently deletes network:dhcp
ports out of the database directly since it calls the private _delete_port()
method. This patch changes that to call delete_port so that the plugin can
delete these ports from their backend.

Change-Id: I64d1cbac53365a5b6bb194a891bd833bd80ff9fa
Closes-bug: #1290983

commit_message:
Fix for Authentication scenario to correctly use self.clients

Scenario has recently been refactored, self.clients in Scenario
now takes the name of the CLI client. During the refactoring,
the Authenticate scenario was not correctly updated, which
causes the authentication scenario to fail. This patch fixes
that.

Change-Id: I546c0846e00a5285f0d47bc80b6304a53cc566ff
Closes-Bug: #1291386

commit_message:
Add get_by_network() to FixedIPList

This adds support for get_by_network() to FixedIPList, which is needed
by the linux_net module to go full-objects. Since it depends on
information in the VirtualInterface object, this also adds a nested
FixedIP.virtual_interface object, which currently is only reachable
when queried in this way.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: I6b53e6eed1dee049a51d95f385132fc28c7cce05
Related-bug: 1290568

It turns out that grenade sets gitbase, however some of our

Change-Id: I820b661dacee019928200935ae10d1e36d7b821b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
disconnect novnc from gitbase

It turns out that grenade sets gitbase, however some of our
repositories don't have git.openstack.org repos. This causes a
really interesting failure case with grenade because novnc checkout
fails, then it does a checkout to master of nova.

Change-Id: I820b661dacee019928200935ae10d1e36d7b821b

commit_message:
Add hostname to stats

As Murano has multi-service deployment it is
necessary to add hostname to each stats
in order to understand which API service
provides them.

Change-Id: I9770e37fa7c230c8736280d966efe4b13b6e616e
Partly-Implements: blueprint api-request-stats

subject: Rename --timeout global option and make it work
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-10 23:23:42.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/common/http.py', 'heatclient/tests/test_common_http.py', 'heatclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Rename --timeout global option and make it work

The --timeout option doesn't work for standalone use-cases when
you specify no-client-auth, and it's also confusing since it's
easily misinterpreted as an option related to the heat timeouts
provided to stack-create and in future stack-update.

So take this opportunity to rename the option to --api-timeout,
which hopefully more accurately reflects it's purpose, and don't
pass a default (just let requests use the global default socket
timeout) as it seems relatively unlikely users will wait for 10
minutes before pressing Ctrl-C on interactive shell requests.

Change-Id: I52480f0d128735bf5f312fc88f4078f27717baf2
Partial-Bug: #1290456
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rename --timeout global option and make it work

The --timeout option doesn't work for standalone use-cases when
you specify no-client-auth, and it's also confusing since it's
easily misinterpreted as an option related to the heat timeouts
provided to stack-create and in future stack-update.

So take this opportunity to rename the option to --api-timeout,
which hopefully more accurately reflects it's purpose, and don't
pass a default (just let requests use the global default socket
timeout) as it seems relatively unlikely users will wait for 10
minutes before pressing Ctrl-C on interactive shell requests.

Change-Id: I52480f0d128735bf5f312fc88f4078f27717baf2
Partial-Bug: #1290456

subject: Switch to unsafe cache mode for test VMs.
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-12 18:06:01.000000000', 'files': ['templates/vm.xml'], 'message': 'Switch to unsafe cache mode for test VMs.

We have no precious data in these in general. They are explicitly a
testbed for folk without access to baremetal. Making the cache be
unsafe saves about 5m on a CI test run (and will reduce sync pressure
for local development too).

Change-Id: I1b91b399f872adf973836326bf3d303287c98f66
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Switch to unsafe cache mode for test VMs.

We have no precious data in these in general. They are explicitly a
testbed for folk without access to baremetal. Making the cache be
unsafe saves about 5m on a CI test run (and will reduce sync pressure
for local development too).

Change-Id: I1b91b399f872adf973836326bf3d303287c98f66

commit_message:
Use os-svc-restart in boot-stack reset-db

This allows us to use map-services to make sure we use the correct
name instead of ||'ing together restart commands.

Change-Id: I42947bbb4f9be20803f540db3e14c19c6bd45755

commit_message:
add parameter for endpoint protocols

This gives the ability to specify https endpoint for
internal and/or admin endpoints.

Change-Id: I1f7d96693a5bc2140041658e77cc7920f9577eac
backport: havana

commit_message:
Allow marconi-server to properly daemonize

This patch allows marconi-server to properly detach from the controlling terminal and daemonize.

Change-Id: Ib6eabf8c44c5526ea71f913908bf2d4d37c06511
Closes-Bug: #1287490

commit_message:
Add the install_rally.sh file

The install_rally.sh file is a Bash script that installs Rally on a
Unix system. Specifically, it is able to install and configure Rally
either globally (system-wide, the default behavior), or isolated in a
virtual environment using the virtualenv tool.

Change-Id: I4b6498a52cb1105fd8e27593ac482038ddcff702
Implements: blueprint rally-installation-script

commit_message:
Fix string format used to report content validation errors

The format used ('{!s}') was not compatible with Python 2.6. Replaced
this format with ('{0}').

Change-Id: Iab252cf867f16e4da354d9634d8ae4712fefb77e
Closes-Bug: #1291482

commit_message:
Fix and enable import checks

This patch fixes and enables:
* F401 unused imports
* H301 one import per line
* H302 import only modules
* H306 imports not in alphabetical order

Change-Id: I6f7f92004844184dc4bbea8c3a1ddfc196310b39

Mention tox as a prereq

grenade uses tox to run the tempest smoke tests, but doesn't do anything
to install it.

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-06 19:53:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixed nova VM live migration issue with 3PAR

Nova bypasses the cinder checks for a volume
being available, when it tries to attach a volume
to a new host during live migration.  The assumption
in cinder to this point has been that volumes can only
be attached to one host.  The 3PAR driver worked under
that assumption.  This assumption fell apart during detach
time as the driver was only looking for a VLUN on the
entire 3PAR, since it assumed it could only exist on one host.

This patch ensures that the driver looks for the VLUN on the
hostname it expects.

Change-Id: Ie894ad386990794d270ca1cb72f40095bd40c2e6
Closes-Bug: 1288927
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-03-06 19:53:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixed nova VM live migration issue with 3PAR

commit_message:
Fixed nova VM live migration issue with 3PAR

Nova bypasses the cinder checks for a volume
being available, when it tries to attach a volume
to a new host during live migration.  The assumption
in cinder to this point has been that volumes can only
be attached to one host.  The 3PAR driver worked under
that assumption.  This assumption fell apart during detach
time as the driver was only looking for a VLUN on the
entire 3PAR, since it assumed it could only exist on one host.

This patch ensures that the driver looks for the VLUN on the
hostname it expects.

Change-Id: Ie894ad386990794d270ca1cb72f40095bd40c2e6
Closes-Bug: 1288927

commit_message:
Retry logic for SSH connection in Cloud Server resource

There is a known issue with some Rackspace Cloud Server images where
they occasionally refuse SSH connections for a few seconds just after
becoming 'ACTIVE'.  This causes the stack creation to fail.

To avoid this, keep trying to initialize the SSH connection for up to 30
TaskRunner cycles.

Closes-Bug: #1287331
Change-Id: Icf28fb3c0de21cf733c4dd0d28a7b653af1bcd0b

commit_message:
Revert "Adding image multiple location support"

This reverts commit a55bbbfa1957d02b3006a51afcf4984a1f8ff886.

The series of patches involved with adding this feature introduced
an unexpected dependency on glance's v2 API, which we do not
currently support. Triggering a user-facing bug quickly, and leaving
some uncertainty about what else is likely to come in the future,
a revert of this code was decided given the short time to -rc1.

Closes-bug: 1291014
Change-Id: I2ed6a861e583b9513b0984ff9801d4b9f7536798

The series of patches involved with adding this feature introduced
an unexpected dependency on glance's v2 API, which we do not
currently support. Triggering a user-facing bug quickly, and leaving
some uncertainty about what else is likely to come in the future,
a revert of this code was decided given the short time to -rc1.

commit_message:
Adding domain to context

Add support for upcoming "domain" concept in Keystone V3 API in
the context.

This fix ensures there is a user_identity in the context for the
corresponding new attribute in the log format string added in oslo. The
oslo change has the same change-id as this one.

Closes-Bug: #1290503
Change-Id: Ic2cf3e52cfcc0b8adccdf9c59afaa4014708a303

commit_message:
Fix problem of deleting dhcp port

when network is deleted, the dhcp port in that network will be deleted
automaticly, so '_cleanup_ports' should not clean dhcp port. I already
have a patch to fix the problem of deleting dhcp port.

Change-Id: I92f90a3dad6d76954d466e4b30ab7c46434ba7df
Closes-bug: #1279683

assertEqual which is more direct in this case than
assertIsNotNone.

  is being tested and what is just an assertion to ensure that the

  test_list_networks and test_list_networks_fields.

* Create assertEmpty and assertNotEmpty methods to help further clarify
  the intent of certain assertions.

commit_message:
Improve readability of test_networks

* Use list comprehension where it makes sense.

* Remove redundant assertions. That is, assertions in some tests that
  are really the responsibility of another test. For example, checking
  if a given network id is present in a list was being checked in both
  test_list_networks and test_list_networks_fields.

* Create assertEmpty and assertNotEmpty methods to help further clarify
  the intent of certain assertions.

Change-Id: Id91b2d2b6699eaf4acc332b3e76f9cb46c09d7c7

commit_message:
purge packages between integration tests

Otherwise cuttlefish won't be installed if emperor is already there,
which defeats the purpose of integration tests.

Change-Id: I1bf3a8aa9ae3447d424a70e97b57b4f63cf29228
Signed-off-by: Loic Dachary <loic@dachary.org>

subject: Merge Block Storage into Overcloud
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-11 16:04:21.000000000', 'files': ['Makefile'], 'message': 'Merge Block Storage into Overcloud

This patch removes the seperate overcloud-with-block-storage.yaml
make target and merges the functionality into the main overcloud.yaml
target.  The default BLOCKSTORAGESCALE is 0. Change this number to add
additional block storage nodes.

This patch also updates the overcloud-with-block-storage-nfs target
to more closely resemble the overcloud.yaml target, including swift
and ssl templates as needed. The default BLOCKSTORAGESCALE is 1.
Change this number to add additional block storage nodes.

Change-Id: Ifcc733cfbf9f356393c3f6c72b2bbbb0214d3040
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Merge Block Storage into Overcloud

This patch removes the seperate overcloud-with-block-storage.yaml
make target and merges the functionality into the main overcloud.yaml
target.  The default BLOCKSTORAGESCALE is 0. Change this number to add
additional block storage nodes.

This patch also updates the overcloud-with-block-storage-nfs target
to more closely resemble the overcloud.yaml target, including swift
and ssl templates as needed. The default BLOCKSTORAGESCALE is 1.
Change this number to add additional block storage nodes.

Change-Id: Ifcc733cfbf9f356393c3f6c72b2bbbb0214d3040

commit_message:
Implement basic functionality of tiled App Catalog.

Implement both Index page and App Details page. Right now it uses fake
model application, but UI render part is complete.  There is no error
handling here yet, it should be added later.

Also basic image handling (for icons) is implemented:
* added images for app entries and details page.
* added image caching logic to store images on local disk.
* added Content-Cache header to cache images on client side too.

Partially implements: blueprint app-catalog-ui
Change-Id: Ibaff5b7805b6fa45906e6247619483af924889d9

subject: Default value for database.connection config option
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-11 22:07:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Default value for database.connection config option

Before the code merge from review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76204/,
the default value for database.connection was (in
etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample):
    #connection=sqlite:////ironic/openstack/common/db/$sqlite_db

After the merge, there was no default value.

This sets the default to be the same value as before. 'sqlite_db'
needs to be in the DEFAULT group, in order to be used as a template
variable.

Change-Id: I8e8168cef0494e803857d43c3a837e13e3e494fb
Closes-Bug: #1290645
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-03-12 16:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/openstack/common/db/options.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/tests/base.py'], 'message': "Default value for database.connection config option

Before the code merge from review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76204/,
the default value for database.connection was (in
etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample):
    #connection=sqlite:////ironic/openstack/common/db/$sqlite_db

After the merge, there was no default value.

This sets the default to be the same value as before. 'sqlite_db'
needs to be in the DEFAULT group, in order to be used as a template
variable.

Change-Id: I8e8168cef0494e803857d43c3a837e13e3e494fb
Closes-Bug: #1290645
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Default value for database.connection config option

Before the code merge from review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76204/,
the default value for database.connection was (in
etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample):
    #connection=sqlite:////ironic/openstack/common/db/$sqlite_db

After the merge, there was no default value.

This sets the default to be the same value as before. 'sqlite_db'
needs to be in the DEFAULT group, in order to be used as a template
variable.

Change-Id: I8e8168cef0494e803857d43c3a837e13e3e494fb
Closes-Bug: #1290645

commit_message:
pin nose to 1.3.0

Nose 1.3.1 introduces a problem that causes tests to fail under python
3, which is preventing any changes in oslo-incubator. Stick with 1.3.0
until another release is available.

https://github.com/nose-devs/nose/commit/c51ff6ffda7e8b36eaa1152090e6238479610d7d

Change-Id: If3f6487f56cb8fc08ffe55fcf7bb5eca43d0ac2f

subject: Add shelve_offload test for Nova API
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-19 12:42:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add shelve_offload test for Nova v3 API

On compute nodes which are configured with shelved_offload_time > 1,
the shelve API changes a server status to SHELVED and a server image
remains in the node. The shelve_offload API offloads the server image
from the node. This patch adds the API test for Nova v3 API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

commit_message:
Add shelve_offload test for Nova API

On compute nodes which are configured with shelved_offload_time = -1,
the shelve API changes a server status to SHELVED and a server image
remains in the node. The shelve_offload API offloads the server image
from the node. This patch adds the API test for Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

Change-Id: Iaa2f94c3381c8b68df7fe132e1c13b4b81962b8c

commit_message:
Add support for negative tests with admin client

This adds the missing support for admin clients and implements an
example based on flavor creation. Instead of listing all result code
checks it is now possible to define on default.

Change-Id: I9512c1b91eb227e35faf24e3e88ed73a6ed3b734
Partially-implements: bp autogen-negative-tests

commit_message:
Do not restart libvirt if n-cpu is disabled

If this service is disable in localrc, libvirt does not installed at all,
and should not be restarted.

Change-Id: Iaf482d4a82a26546c25249b3e32c7e629d862a1b
Closes: bug 1288236

commit_message:
add check to create ~/.ssh/ to install-dependencies

The script breaks if ran on a fresh install without
a $HOME/.ssh/ directory. So let's make sure we have one.
Additionally, don't create (and set the mode of) one if
one already exists

Change-Id: Id7a2ef668ee31f00ecccb08a2b888f94ffbac06f

commit_message:
Fix gettextutil.Message handling of deep copy failures

Broadened deep copy exception handling and changed the keyword
dictionary deep copy to doing each element separately so that only
the failing dictionary item is converted to unicode.

Also added test cases.

Closes-bug: #1290468
Change-Id: I15f3880b32bec55bb61d96af41762c98486a274d

commit_message:
Pecan TransactionHook was added

All actions that were implemented on ExceptionHandlingHook and
SessionHook were moved to CustomTransanctionalHook which introduces more
flexible way to manage db communications while request processing via
pecan.

Change-Id: I8ab20b4be30d307b3c25fff27dc774209c8522ad

simplified. Now session is created only when it is desperately needed and
its using is maximized instead of uncontrollable producing for each and

commit_message:
Complete session hadling refactoring

All parts of system have been refactored. Session creation has been
simplified. Now session is created only when it is desperately needed and
its using is maximized instead of uncontrollable producing for each and
every block of code which is supposed to communicate with db.

This refactoring simplifies db data transfer management and makes it
more explicit for further developing.

Unit and functional tests have been updated.

Change-Id: I15a980432f9da5cac5f04b1f4f4af64d1a002b60

commit_message:
Modify assert statement when comparing with None

Replace assertEqual(None, *) with assertIsNone in heat's
tests to have more clear messages in case of failure.
Also, replace assertNotEqual(None, *) with assertIsNotNone
for the same reason.

Change-Id: I34dbf9b87c7c8c6ca4949b53bd5ef763a9c2fc24
Closes-Bug: #1280522

commit_message:
Fix missing package dependency for requests

The package named requests is used by NetApp eseries
driver for doing client/server communications. This entry
is absent in requirements.txt. The patch fixes it.

Closes-bug: #1291325

Change-Id: I044ecce433d3d9e0409762a3e4551e1ce17f607d

commit_message:
Make heat stack-create waits fail fast

Updates the devtest_overcloud.sh and devtest_undercloud.sh
scripts so that our stack-ready command loops are fail fast.
This should avoid having end users and CI runs hit the
wait timeout before we discover that an error has occurred.

Change-Id: Ib23d8e127570a9fe80affa93be68f7cc9815a610

commit_message:
Add puppet-3.4 support

Adding puppet-3.4 support. It also should work under puppet-2.7.
In order to work properly with puppet-3.4 also requires some updates
in packages:
- ruby-rgen >= 0.6.5
- hiera >= 1.3.1

Change-Id: I40ffb6961e2b6de8090040f545648143e926872d

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-11 21:34:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Ensure is_image_available handles V2 Glance API

The V2 Glance API uses warlock to validate returned models
from calls such as GET /images/{id}. The get_locations() call in
the Nova Glance image driver was using the V2 Glance API call
to GET /images/{id} (which is correct, since image locations only
exist in the V2 API), but the GlanceImageService._is_image_available()
method was checking the is_public attribute of the supplied image model.

This caused warlock to throw an exception since is_public is not
an attribute on the V2 API's returned image model in glanceclient.
This change adds some checks that can handle both the V2 and V1 returned
image models from glanceclient and a bunch of unit tests to thoroughly
exercise the is_image_available method.

Change-Id: I35b5af8331c5972bd89e1a674091fa2e3bde28a7
Closes-bug: #1291014

commit_message:
Ensure is_image_available handles V2 Glance API

The V2 Glance API uses warlock to validate returned models
from calls such as GET /images/{id}. The get_locations() call in
the Nova Glance image driver was using the V2 Glance API call
to GET /images/{id} (which is correct, since image locations only
exist in the V2 API), but the GlanceImageService._is_image_available()
method was checking the is_public attribute of the supplied image model.

This caused warlock to throw an exception since is_public is not
an attribute on the V2 API's returned image model in glanceclient.
This change adds some checks that can handle both the V2 and V1 returned
image models from glanceclient and a bunch of unit tests to thoroughly
exercise the is_image_available method.

Change-Id: I35b5af8331c5972bd89e1a674091fa2e3bde28a7
Closes-bug: #1291014

commit_message:
Remove Duplicate Rabbit Parameters

This patch removes the duplicate rabbit username and password
parameters.  These parameters cause a conflict when running
merge.py because they already exist in the overcloud template.

Change-Id: I01d386577734c7c516a477e1e402882294ac4376

subject: Use github as default GIT_BASE
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-12 16:11:11.000000000', 'files': ['grenaderc'], 'message': "Use github as default GIT_BASE

git.openstack.org doesn't have a copy of noVNC lying around, and the way
stable/havana devstack works, it will end up checkout master nova repo
instead of stable/havana.

Even if devstack stable/havana cannot cd into a repo it still calls git

Change-Id: I5cfb5f6f702fbe9e80fe02a897735c5f96bae3c7
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use github as default GIT_BASE

git.openstack.org doesn't have a copy of noVNC lying around, and the way
stable/havana devstack works, it will end up checkout master nova repo
instead of stable/havana.

Even if devstack stable/havana cannot cd into a repo it still calls git
checkout.

Change-Id: I5cfb5f6f702fbe9e80fe02a897735c5f96bae3c7

commit_message:
Add deletion of floating ip after disassociation

First problem - we have 2 very simmilar tests
that differs only by 1 step. In this patch
this 2 tests merge into 1.

Second one - during the tests we do not release
floating ip, we just disassociate it,
and release only in teardown(
when all tests from suite were executed).To fix this issue
add floating ip deleteion as a separate step

Change-Id: I5cc0a782cdc5914e250ae5176aa8a724b797a934
Closes-bug: #1288547

commit_message:
Fix unit tests running unnecessarily slow

Mocked/reduced various sleeps that got triggered on certain tests that
caused the tests to run unnecessary slow.

commit_message:
Add default user_identity to logging record

Just like instance and color formatting parameters we can't assume that
the user_identity will always be in the logging record. This patch adds
a default value for it if missing to avoid exceptions.

Change-Id: Id02902adb2579d44f1f4f066757ef3855b5ece87
Closes-Bug: #1290503

commit_message:
Set 'period', 'duration' config parameters in seconds

Parameters 'period' and 'duration' from task config for periodic
and coninuous runners, respectively, are set in seconds, according
to docstring. However, in code they are multiplied by 60 and thus
effectively set minutes, not seconds. This change is intended to
restore the consistency of code.

bug #1285074

Change-Id: I7617f6b59d3768ee7b280c48fdf70d6d60eb3fec

commit_message:
Drop the os-svc-install -n -c options.

Updates os-svc-install so that we disallow the -n and -c options.

Also, corrects the optargs for -h so that it doesn't take a parameter.
And fix some variable bound issues that could occur if the script
was executed with invalid args.

Change-Id: I4eb26fe6793aa1ad19b1dddc63a5f399e17a8325
Closes-bug: #1285283

commit_message:
Stop using the os-svc-install -n -c options.

We are repeatedly using the -n and -c options which don't
do anything. This removes the use of the unused options.

Partial-bug: #1285283

Change-Id: Ie67f3dfc1461ad41dcf130122902d4f1325e38ba

commit_message:
Add PEP-257 Testing Tools

Add pep257 checker and flake8 plugin to check (and
maybe eventually gate) on PEP-257 rules for
docstrings.

The hacking guide defers to PEP-257 for
docstrings, but projects done' currently check for
that.

We're adding this to satori checks and gates (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/79013/) and we've
got our tests working. This will allow us to
demonstrate that we can check and gate on PEP-257
compatibility (alongside the hacking plugin).

- Projects are active; we just got some patches
merged in.
- They are python 3.x compatible.
- pep257 and the flake8 plugin have MIT licenses.
- The packages are available on pypi.

Change-Id: I7d8b9510e055dbeb77a60a382e67a0e0a3c2787b

commit_message:
Improve Ironic Conductor threading & locks

Ironic Conductor is not consistently using worker threads and
locks as it should.  Instead, it should be using greenthreads
where appropriate to spawn off tasks so that Conductor is freed
up.  This patch corrects do_node_tear_down().

Change-Id: Ia707766855bd7ec47a5af05e119b126504ddc0b1
Partial-Bug: #1285507

commit_message:
sql backend throwing DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message

BaseException.message has been deprecated. i'm inclined to believe
that args[0] is the correct alternative as even sqlalchemy appears
to use it for their own exceptions:

https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/blob/1af8e2491dcbed723d2cdafd44fd37f1a6908e91/lib/sqlalchemy/exc.py

Change-Id: Ic0a9087c94c9ee494c63def6d78e06fe3475d325
Partial-Bug: #1257530

commit_message:
Add repeatable single ostf tests

To get possibility execute single ostf test
n times new test was added:
* deploy simple nova vlan, by default execute 50
  times test for verification public connectivity
  by floating ip
* deploy simple nova flat, by default execute 50
  times test for verification public connectivity
  by floating ip

Also there is possibility to change count of execution
and tests that should be invoked by environment
variables

Change-Id: Id7b09ccf7c398262f7ec3ebcbd222f349be95fc6

commit_message:
Fix excessive logging from db.sqlalchemy.session

A message about the MySQL server mode was logged at the info level
every time a connection was checked out. This happens often, and
logging every time is unnecessary.

Here's an example of the message when using the default
configuration:

 MySQL server mode set to STRICT_TRANS_TABLES,STRICT_ALL_TABLES,...

The fix is to send the message once per engine creation. Also,
this message is now logged the debug level since there's a warning
logged if the mode isn't a "safe" one already.

Closes-Bug: #1288443
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I13b24d04c28e69a8534aaa8d3a4463ca1d65570f

commit_message:
Add lockutils fixture to OpportunisticTestCase

We're getting hit hard with db race problems right now and the
proper fix can't go in until infra has all of their regions
updated.  Using the lock fixture to serialize all of the db tests
should help with the problem until infra is ready.

Change-Id: If883832b0eba08f1508a247310b8eebd67b27971
Partial-Bug: #1288916

The latest patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/77067

missed packages.

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make yum install ignore missing packages if architecture is ppc64

There's a few packages missing in ppc64 architecture.
The latest patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/77067
Broken the devstack in ppc64 due the check if there's
missed packages.
This patch check if the architecture is ppc64 if so
uses the old way, just with yum install -y.
Otherwise, it will use the new check.

Change-Id: I3fd4aeaf183b8def787ba677f8941bf52e5d1b53

commit_message:
Be smarter about config generator default package name

Using python setup.py --name instead of the current working
directory will allow the config generator to work correctly by
default even if the local source tree was cloned into a directory
that doesn't match the project name.

Change-Id: Iea529e7e691d94402f658e7095387dc3e98e32fe
Closes-Bug: #1288417

commit_message:
VMware: ensure that deprecation does not appear for VC driver

Commit d041b95b8977e77a51e6031c38f0011b44d3266a added the
deprecation warning for the ESX driver. This warning should
not appear for the VC driver.

Closes-bug: #1291238

commit_message:
Don't raise exception if deploy_id not found

Currently envutuils.default_deployment_id raises an exception if there
is no active deployment (one that has been recorded previously with use
ore create). This patch changes the method to return None instead.

Change-Id: I57052e5d4862d80b95a45eb582702ce009a4f22f
Closes-Bug: #1291298

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-07 22:37:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix compute_node stats

The compute_node object has several issues with the stats field
that are cleaned up by this patch, including the following:

- obj_make_compatible() should check the stats property exists
  before attempting to delete it
- from_db_object() should not create the stats property if it
  is not in the database field (it is a nullable field)
- create() should convert the stats property to its database
  field format if it is present
- tests for create() and save() should check that the database
  format conversion is done

This method does not change any fields so there is no change to
the object's version.

Change-Id: I5c68994d618f0ecf9409c37321bc87a006c431ac
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-03-09 08:36:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_compute_node.py', 'nova/objects/compute_node.py'], 'message': "Fix compute_node stats

The compute_node object has several issues with the stats field
that are cleaned up by this patch, including the following:

- obj_make_compatible() should check the stats property exists
  before attempting to delete it
- from_db_object() should not create the stats property if it
  is not in the database field (it is a nullable field)
- create() should convert the stats property to its database
  field format if it is present
- tests for create() and save() should check that the database
  format conversion is done

This method does not change any fields so there is no change to
the object's version.

Change-Id: I5c68994d618f0ecf9409c37321bc87a006c431ac
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix compute_node stats

The compute_node object has several issues with the stats field
that are cleaned up by this patch, including the following:

- obj_make_compatible() should check the stats property exists
  before attempting to delete it
- from_db_object() should not create the stats property if it
  is not in the database field (it is a nullable field)
- create() should convert the stats property to its database
  field format if it is present
- tests for create() and save() should check that the database
  format conversion is done

This method does not change any fields so there is no change to
the object's version.

Change-Id: I5c68994d618f0ecf9409c37321bc87a006c431ac

For example, test_show_* checks only equality of name and id;
test_associate_disassociate_health_monitor_with_pool does not check
that pool containts healthmonitor after assosiating.

This tests should be corrected.

Closes-bug: #1262112

commit_message:
Verify more information in API tests for LBaaS

In API tests for LBaaS not all information is checked  that is
required.
For example, test_show_* checks only equality of name and id;
test_associate_disassociate_health_monitor_with_pool does not check
that pool containts healthmonitor after assosiating.

This tests should be corrected.

Also create_member and update_member was updated to use _create and
_update from network_client_base.

Closes-bug: #1262112

Change-Id: I352253ce9e28b46324a81e40c6b86759e0687420

subject: Recover from REBOOT-* state on compute manager start-up
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1865, 'name': 'Andrea Rosa', 'email': 'andrea.rosa@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-rosa-m'}, {'_account_id': 1882, 'name': 'dave-mcnally', 'email': 'dave.mcnally@hpe.com', 'username': 'dave-mcnally'}, {'_account_id': 2835, 'name': 'Brian Elliott', 'email': 'bdelliott@gmail.com', 'username': 'belliott'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7040, 'name': 'GuoHui LIu', 'email': 'liuguohui@gmail.com', 'username': 'guohliu'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-22 16:27:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Recover from REBOOT-* state on compute manager start-up

If a compute manager is stopped / fails during certain REBOOT-*
operations then the instance will be left stuck in a transitional
task_state

This change handles two possible task states REBOOT_PENDING and
REBOOT_STARTED (for both soft and hard reboots). And either clears
these states or retries the reboot depending on the instance state.

Both task states are set after the request has gotten to the compute
manager so we can handle these safely knowing the operation has
ended/failed with the restart of the compute manager.

We retry the reboot where the state is PENDING and where the state is
STARTED and the instance is not running.

Where the instance is running and the state is STARTED we simply
transition the instance to an ACTIVE state. The user can retry the
reboot if required.

Related to blueprint recover-stuck-state

Change-Id: Ib318b3d444a67616441302f3daa8de20ee946f3f

ended/failed with the restart of the compute manager.

We retry the reboot where the state is PENDING and where the state is
STARTED and the instance is not running.

Where the instance is running and the state is STARTED we simply
transition the instance to an ACTIVE state. The user can retry the
reboot if required.

Related to blueprint recover-stuck-state

commit_message:
Recover from REBOOT-* state on compute manager start-up

If a compute manager is stopped / fails during certain REBOOT-*
operations then the instance will be left stuck in a transitional
task_state

This change handles two possible task states REBOOT_PENDING and
REBOOT_STARTED (for both soft and hard reboots). And either clears
these states or retries the reboot depending on the instance state.

Both task states are set after the request has gotten to the compute
manager so we can handle these safely knowing the operation has
ended/failed with the restart of the compute manager.

We retry the reboot where the state is PENDING and where the state is
STARTED and the instance is not running.

Where the instance is running and the state is STARTED we simply
transition the instance to an ACTIVE state. The user can retry the
reboot if required.

Related to blueprint recover-stuck-state

Change-Id: Ib318b3d444a67616441302f3daa8de20ee946f3f

fix --excluded of meter-label-rule-create is not working

commit_message:
Improve compatibility between Keystone V2 and V3

To improve compatibility between Keystone V2 and V3, this renames the
client @property in both of them from self.client_v2 and self.client_v3
to just self.client.

This allows both of them to be used by third party contrib plugins in a
seamless manner.

Closes-Bug: 1289528
Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I60412ecb1665232ffeeeb869fb00d368604601d2

commit_message:
policy: rename Exception to avoid nose regression

The name TestException makes nose think that this is a test case, so it
fails with nose 1.3.1. Renaming the exception thinks that problem.

Change-Id: I50b760ec24a67900f80d961f738d5fd7643561bc

subject: Bug 1273273 :if run 'keystone-manage db_sync' without 'sudo', there should be a prompt that tables not created
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-12 09:22:37.000000000', 'files': ['bin/keystone-manage'], 'message': "Bug 1273273 :if run 'keystone-manage db_sync' without 'sudo', there should be a prompt that tables not created

The bug fix is to raise a more user-friendly exception if keystone.conf cannot be read

commit_message:
Bug 1273273 :if run 'keystone-manage db_sync' without 'sudo', there should be a prompt that tables not created

The bug fix is to raise a more user-friendly exception if keystone.conf cannot be read

Fixes Bug1273273

Change-Id: I1f28a5561e051e9d5775691f217320b926699ec6

commit_message:
create_server fails if server is not unique

The error message for the exception is:
(IntegrityError) UNIQUE constrait failed: table.column ....
The fix is to add the string "unique constraint failed" when looking
for IntegrityErrors to convert to exceptions.Duplicates.
Closes-Bug: 1290560
Change-Id: Id8e28443cf238a888e780f38f983129e5ac1d2f0

commit_message:
Add plan_uuid to the assembly api model

In the current API state, it is not possible to create an assembly
other than parsing the plan_uri field, we should be able to pass
the plan uuid during the creation.

Change-Id: I718036a09e4d621e7e0b35a46c2e0a8236501f10

commit_message:
moves default keystone API to v3

v2.0 of the keystone API was deprecated in icehouse-2, moving to
support v3 by default.

This also fixes a bug in Horizon where if you specify v3 for the
API version and v2.0 is still the auth url, login fails.

Implements blueprint keystone-v3-default
Partial-bug: #1267636

Change-Id: Ibc4872f24125fa74230eab781b002dffdba5f5da

commit_message:
Fix get_download_hander() typo

Clearly, this was meant to be get_download_handler().

Refactor loading modules in GlanceImageService a little to avoid the
get_download_handler() going over the length-of-line limit.

Change-Id: If871413cbb86cd800be8517bb37932df890bf53d

commit_message:
Added eventlet connections pool for SQL

Connections pooling is needed because the collector only ever grabs
one connection to the database at a time. this causes a massive
backlog on the message queue.

reuses Change-Id: I5ccdc141c441db32fab361783a31a96015516878

Change-Id: I8b2f70516e03c5a2fab0042e2640b1e3f4942a30
Closes-Bug: #1291054

commit_message:
Make savanna able to be executed/used as sahara

* add endpoint alias for cli;
* add saharaclient package with link to the savanna client.

In future we'll remove savanna endpoints.

Change-Id: Iec7fd8b13f7a6f1e1ab84a22b5175954189018a3

Make savanna able to be executed as sahara

* read config files from sahara places;
* add endpoint aliases for api and db-amange.

In future we'll remove savanna endpoints.

subject: Use stack ID to create domain project name
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-06 03:02:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use stack ID to create domain project name

If the project for a given stack didn't get deleted for any reason then
launching a stack with the same name will fail as project names
are enforced to be unique.

By using the stack ID instead this issue is avoided if the project delete
didn't occur.

The resulting project name is truncated to the limit of 64.

Change-Id: Iba09cf94bdaa6a92d9520ed1743805862dc1b14d
Closes-Bug: #1288514
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-03-12 01:17:52.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack_user.py', 'heat/tests/fakes.py', 'heat/common/heat_keystoneclient.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_user.py', 'heat/tests/test_user.py', 'heat/tests/test_heatclient.py'], 'message': "Use stack ID to create domain project name

If the project for a given stack didn't get deleted for any reason then
launching a stack with the same name will fail as project names
are enforced to be unique.

By using the stack ID instead this issue is avoided if the project delete
didn't occur.

The resulting project name is truncated to the limit of 64.

Change-Id: Iba09cf94bdaa6a92d9520ed1743805862dc1b14d
Closes-Bug: #1288514
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Use stack ID to create domain project name

If the project for a given stack didn't get deleted for any reason then
launching a stack with the same name will fail as project names
are enforced to be unique.

By using the stack ID instead this issue is avoided if the project delete
didn't occur.

The resulting project name is truncated to the limit of 64.

Change-Id: Iba09cf94bdaa6a92d9520ed1743805862dc1b14d
Closes-Bug: #1288514

commit_message:
Remove copyright from empty files

According to policy change in HACKING:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing
empty files should no longer contain copyright notices.

Change-Id: I5745cf1963f442adc7de2e0f54a3ea39d7bc8edd

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-11 10:30:48.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/sample_environment.json'], 'message': "Add more NICs to nodes in sample_environment.json

Some nodes in sample_environment.json contains only one NIC. So if somebody
tries to run fake deploy process he'll fail because of error:

    Some untagged networks are assigned to the same physical interface.
    You should assign them to different physical interfaces

Since now, all the nodes have at least two NICs.

Change-Id: I2901809063701a89f2f7bcd5a419e97759580da3
Closes-Bug: #1271129
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add more NICs to nodes in sample_environment.json

Some nodes in sample_environment.json contains only one NIC. So if somebody
tries to run fake deploy process he'll fail because of error:

    Some untagged networks are assigned to the same physical interface.
    You should assign them to different physical interfaces

Since now, all the nodes have at least two NICs.

Change-Id: I2901809063701a89f2f7bcd5a419e97759580da3
Closes-Bug: #1271129

subject: Fix small misuse of cast within oslo.messaging wrapper
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-28 09:35:44.000000000', 'files': ['climate/utils/service.py'], 'message': "Fix small misuse of cast within oslo.messaging wrapper

cast() method doesn't return a value, the wrapper should do the same
accordingly.

See https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/Messaging#Client_Side_API

Change-Id: I8ab6f77fbb622134e434660c2a662ea08474e51f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix small misuse of cast within oslo.messaging wrapper

cast() method doesn't return a value, the wrapper should do the same
accordingly.

See https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/Messaging#Client_Side_API

Change-Id: I8ab6f77fbb622134e434660c2a662ea08474e51f

commit_message:
VMware: image cache aging

The current patch set deletes cached images that are no longer used.
Images that are unused will be marked for aging. These images
will be deleted after they have not been used for
'remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds'.

The third and final phase of blueprint vmware-image-cache-management.

NOTE: in order to ensure that there will not be race conditions with
multiple compute nodes, each compute node will have its own datastore
cache directory. This will be a combination of the configuration
variables my_ip and image_cache_subdirectory_name. If the aging is
disabled then the original base is used (ensures backwards
compatibility).

Locking is done when accessing timestamps to detect if an image has aged
in the cache.

Change-Id: Iec47c28a38761c187226c5eff3ab69da503437f6

The network_get_associated_fixed_ips() db api method returns a
dict of randomness that is neither a model, nor a mapping to one.
In order to replace this method with an object call, we need to
make it do something a little more helpful.

This patch simply refactors it to return the same data, but in model
form that we can reasonably turn into an object in a later patch.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Related-bug: 1290568
Change-Id: Ia6bb88f51ed31fb3a48fc52670b978acf8a326dc

commit_message:
Refactor network_get_associated_fixed_ips() for sanity

The network_get_associated_fixed_ips() db api method returns a
dict of randomness that is neither a model, nor a mapping to one.
In order to replace this method with an object call, we need to
make it do something a little more helpful.

This patch simply refactors it to return the same data, but in model
form that we can reasonably turn into an object in a later patch.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Related-bug: 1290568
Change-Id: Ia6bb88f51ed31fb3a48fc52670b978acf8a326dc

commit_message:
Add py27local tox target

This adds a new tox target that uses sitepackages=False. This is
handy for people running unit tests on a devstack box, where the
site-packages oslo.config interferes.

Change-Id: I1101730f18550de0b391d12bcc5841cb671434a2

subject: Updated from global requirements

commit_message:
Rework proxy publish functionality

* Task uuid is not a required parameter now;
* Exchange declaration does not require a connection object.

Change-Id: I9a77c9afe7d9fad007902d77d24a0b1a96c6c519

commit_message:
Raise more information on V2 API volumes when resource not found

NotFound exception is caught in volumes.py on v2 api
and raise HTTPNotFound exception but exception information are
not well specified. This patch adds more information
to the raised exception.

Change-Id: I822011fa77004d1ca01e531842ba73e23317dabe
Closes-Bug: #1275755

commit_message:
Implements monitoring-network-from-opendaylight

This feture is driver of the monitoring-network that collects network
info from OpenDayLight via Statistics REST API, Toporogy REST API and
Switch Manager REST API.

Implements: blueprint monitoring-network-from-opendaylight

Change-Id: Id209a05dfc83500c4aaabdece7e44241853e07dc

commit_message:
Swift storage heat templates

Updated the existing swift-source template to properly list all
swift devices.

Created a new swift-storage-source template to add additional
swift-storage only nodes.

The default SWIFTSTORAGESCALE is 0. Change this number to add
additional swift storage nodes.

Change-Id: Ia05f4ad44593316430d60541106d23b032c3e760

subject: Fix unbound locals in IPAssociationWorkflow
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-11 15:43:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/floating_ips/workflows.py'], 'message': "Fix unbound locals in IPAssociationWorkflow

If an error is raised in the AssociateIPAction we assume that a redirect
will be raised. However, certain exception classes will not result in a
redirect when handled by the standard Horizon exception handler. If the
error handler doesn't re-raise some sort of error, control will be
returned to the statement after the except block and some of the
necessary local variables may be unbound.

This fix simply ensures that all of the necessary locals are bound in
the event that an error does occur.

Change-Id: Ib8c92ab218457e51e521d36bb4778c1dc1025342
Closes-Bug: #1290583
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix unbound locals in IPAssociationWorkflow

If an error is raised in the AssociateIPAction we assume that a redirect
will be raised. However, certain exception classes will not result in a
redirect when handled by the standard Horizon exception handler. If the
error handler doesn't re-raise some sort of error, control will be
returned to the statement after the except block and some of the
necessary local variables may be unbound.

This fix simply ensures that all of the necessary locals are bound in
the event that an error does occur.

Change-Id: Ib8c92ab218457e51e521d36bb4778c1dc1025342
Closes-Bug: #1290583

commit_message:
Use message.requeue instead of message.reject

Message.requeue does exactly the same as message.reject with requeue=True,
so why not to use it directly.

Change-Id: I42462172c2eb5d5c534e3c55ce7dfcc1a7169e31

commit_message:
Copy libvirt log file after tempest run

Gate tests fail sometimes due to libvirt problems, but it is difficult
to investigate their reasons or workarounds because there is not any
log about libvirt.
This patch adds libvirt log file to the gate test directory for digging
libvirt problems in the future.

Change-Id: I8771f825fd3ec9df1ba3053c45ce32296aff0fc4
Related-Bug: #1254872

commit_message:
After bulk create send DHCP notification

In the past send_dhcp_notification only handle single resource
because of VALID_RESOURCES = ['network', 'subnet', 'port'].
When I use bulk created ports to boot instance, the VMs could
not get IP address from DHCP agent. So I add some special handle
in function notify().

Add unit test for bulk create dhcp notification.

Modify a paramter for code style.

Change-Id: Ibf2b3380dc3081beaf0f2f68042b022f2726bbe7
Closes-Bug: #1247902

commit_message:
NSX: Allow multiple references to same gw device

This patch amends a data model in order to allow user to specify
the same gateway device multiple times in a network gateway
specification.

The corresponding migration is also being amended with this
patch. This approach has been preferred to developing another
migration since the migration being amended is still the most
recent one for the NSX plugin.

Change-Id: I4d24837d8d65fc45b838f3b616c9ec8a73a50d9c
Closes-Bug: 1262790

commit_message:
Verify service attributes through Nova "get services" API

This patch adds checks whether a response of Nova "get services" API
includes the attributes to block the backward incompatibility change
in the future.

This patch implements the base part of a response validation.
The design is the following:
 * Each API schema is defined under tempest/api/compute/api_schema/
 * If API schemas of v2 and v3 are the same, define common API schema
   under tempest/api/compute/api_schema/
 * Otherwise, API schemas of v2 should be defined under v2/ and the
   one of v3 should be under v3/
 * Each API schema defines the succeeded status code('status_code')
   and response body('response_body')

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Id0b4c31d47f7c6abafcb3c2ded9309fac61cb3dc

commit_message:
Enable H302 check (api/compute/{c*,f*,i*,s*,t*})

We can use H302 rule but ignore it now. This commit prepares for
enabling H302 rule. But this commit modifies a part of Tempest only
because if we fix all of them at one time, it's hard to merge this
commit.
    ---------------
    tempest/api/compute/admin
    tempest/api/compute/{c*,f*,i*,s*,t*}     <- This patch
    tempest/api/compute/{v3,volumes},data_processing
    tempest/api/identity/admin
    tempest/api/image
    tempest/api/{n*,o*,t*}
    tempest/api/volume,tempest/*
    tempest/services/compute/json
    tempest/services/compute/v3/json
    tempest/services/compute/xml
    tempest/services/identity
    tempest/services/{im*,n*,o*,t*}
    tempest/services/volume
    tempest/clients.py: TBD
    ---------------

Change-Id: I9d4041754df0e9f20937300b1e19c8ae63d4090a

commit_message:
Remove usage of sudo

Remove usage of sudo and update prompts.

Fix instructions for creation of stack user:
* These substeps need to be run as root like its said in the intro.
* First change permissions, then run su. Otherwise the user has no
  permissions to change it.

Change-Id: I59c6acb4d50e7866e60366a8d2f01f4fecedf902

commit_message:
Stop mock patches by default in base test class

Adds a mock.patch.stopall to the base unit test
case cleanup routines to stop patches by default
in unit tests. This behavior can be overwritten
by setting an attribute on the test class if
required.

Also removes the explicit stops in the Cisco n1kv,
VMware, and NEC unit tests to leverage the new
automatic cleanup.

Closes-Bug: #1290550
Change-Id: Ic642430a765ea8deb07ebd88b619da58a58e0edd

commit_message:
Remove import specific validation from tasks resource

Task-type specific validation should not be placed in the the
task resource as this will vary among providers. Validation of
the input values should occur in the task script and be reported
as part of the task status.

Change-Id: Ifbc1af868359e6bd51b18b10cd5402340438917a
Closes-bug: #1288337

commit_message:
Honor OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE=1 in unit tests

Closes-bug: #1213384

Create a base class for all unit tests to derive from.
Check for flags requestion stdout and stderr to be captured.

Allow a vm to boot with multiple vnics on same duplicate L2 Neutron network:
If the same L2 network is requested multiple times in requested_networks or multiple ports on same L2 network are
allocated for the same VM, then it won't raise a DuplicateNetworks exception and create/attach the ports on same network.
It allow booting VMs with multiple vNICs on same Neutron network for instance with --nic net-id <netid1> --nic net-id <netid1>, …
(i.e. ports to be created on the same network) and --nic port-id <portid1> --nic port-id <portid2>, … (i.e. ports already created on the same network).

commit_message:
Boot a VM with multiple vnics on same Network

If the same L2 network is requested multiple times in requested_networks or multiple ports on same L2 network are
allocated for the same VM, then it won't raise a DuplicateNetworks exception and create/attach the ports on same network.
It allow booting VMs with multiple vNICs on same Neutron network for instance with --nic net-id <netid1>
--nic net-id <netid1>, … (i.e. ports to be created on the same network) and --nic port-id <portid1> --nic port-id
<portid2>, … (i.e. ports already created on the same network).

Closes-Bug: #1187244
Change-Id: Ib42ca070206a6e8cf97622ac1d9cef8e6132edb7

commit_message:
Added logging in setup for ImagesOneServerTestJSON tests

Failures in the setup function would not be logged if there
are more errors in the tearDown code. This fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Idcbf99764c24588482821da00e6a0ec6ceb4e20b
Closes-Bug: #1218475

commit_message:
[DO NOT MERGE] Agent Integration testing

This commit is intended to test the agent remote against CI
integraion tests

 * Increased timeout for volume discovery
 * Made remote pickle everything, not only HTTP response.
 * Fixed wording in help string. The change is suggested by Trevor in
   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/71015/9/etc/savanna/savanna.conf.sample

Change-Id: Id90fa500ca0e334b58907c7aedd719af6981d3d2

If the user attempts to create a snapshot that goes over the alloted
quota, a vague error is given 'Error: Unable to create snapshot'.
Instead catch the appropriate error raised from the Cinder client and

Closes-Bug: #1236711

commit_message:
Give quota error for creating snapshots overquota

If the user attempts to create a snapshot that goes over the alloted
quota, a vague error is given 'Error: Unable to create snapshot'.
Instead catch the appropriate error raised from the Cinder client and
mention the snapshot couldn't be created because of quota.

Change-Id: I6af6c779760774e1d7b574e5a3112c75e65ef394
Closes-Bug: #1236711

commit_message:
Juniper Contrail plug-in implementation for core resources

Adds Juniper Contrail neutron plug-in implementation with unit tests
This patch has no dependency on any other blueprints

- The contrailplugin.py is the main interface for neutron common
  infrastructure
- The ctdb/config_db.py is the interface to reach Juniper/Contrail
  Virtual Network Infrastructure using the vnc_api library

Change-Id: I547426f1d4e0d1a305e179a785a5d517d058c381
Implements: blueprint juniper-plugin-with-extensions

[{'created': '2014-03-04 15:03:59.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Add testr concurrency option for run_tests.sh

By exposing this testr concurrency option, run_tests.sh can now specify
how many processes to run the tests. If not specified, default 0 utilize
maximum CPUs available.

Shamelessly taken from nova.

Change-Id: Iaaea26ed8b8411ef3c8504500436a47b01c4f97f
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add testr concurrency option for run_tests.sh

By exposing this testr concurrency option, run_tests.sh can now specify
how many processes to run the tests. If not specified, default 0 utilize
maximum CPUs available.

Shamelessly taken from nova.

Change-Id: Iaaea26ed8b8411ef3c8504500436a47b01c4f97f
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
remove run_test.sh

Come on people move with the times:
 - use "testr run" for non venv testing
 - use tox for venv testing

Change-Id: Ic2e91ad09e9e6dfdfa4026bcced97fbcc8df0231

commit_message:
Adding extra_specs to flavor show and detail call

In v3 API, adding the extra_specs information of the flavor
in both flavor show and flavor detail calls.

Implements blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list

commit_message:
Sanitize node.last_error message strings

Instead of exposing driver's exception messages in the REST API
via the node.last_error property, this patch simplifies the error
message strings while still logging the full exception for the admin.

This patch also cleans up a few related LOG messages.

Change-Id: I225aab0b6412b2d15acae7cf13206464df260803
Closes-bug: 1265587

commit_message:
Allow update of admin_pass on server

This makes it possible to issue an update that modifies the admin_pass
attribute of a server.  If the server does not support a root password
change, a ResourceFailure will be raised.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint custom-adminpass
Change-Id: Ia2f596c93a2c448b98ac86b96385c8e9015435d4

commit_message:
Adds extraroutes support to neutron routers

Adds a RouterExtraRoutes Neutron resource to allow
extra routes to be added to a neutron router that
supports the extra routes extension.

Implements: blueprint router-properties-object
Change-Id: Ie35213a507a5b8dd1061a6a7ea220b3a1bdb3ec6

commit_message:
Configuration agent for Cisco Service VMs

A generic config agent for configuring L3 services in Cisco devices,
including service VMs.

Implements blueprint: cisco-config-agent
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/cisco-config-agent

Change-Id: If230194f544281131a61c706a7f7c70bdd6c29b6

commit_message:
NSX: allow replication_mode to be configurable

This patch allows the replication mode in nsx to be configurable via devstack.
This is useful for testing as setting to source allows one to use nsx without
having to deploy a service node.

Change-Id: I88da49e0ab415f06cb5a218f921149dbfb7c6f2e

commit_message:
VMware vSphere support: Disk rates

1) Implemented pollsters for following disk rate counters
   - disk.read.bytes.rate
   - disk.read.requests.rate
   - disk.write.bytes.rate
   - disk.write.requests.rate

2) Extended the 'virt.inspector' to return the disk rate stats via
'inspect_disk_rates()'. As of now only vmware.inspector implements this
method.

3) Wrote test cases for the newly added disk rate pollsters and
inspect_disk_rates().

Change-Id: I1089b708ae3b651c95013129dbc0129b419d2b62
Implements: blueprint vmware-vcenter-server

commit_message:
Provide explicit image create value in Registry v2 API test

Assign an explicit created_at datetime value to image db fixtures,
it be used to fixes race condition in Registry v2 API test cases.

Closes-Bug: #1279753
Change-Id: Ia1957e8c024f81eeaa3c0bc094dd62db1be52d07
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

subject: Fixes ssh-injection error while using chap authentication
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-11 17:46:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/eqlx.py', 'cinder/tests/test_eqlx.py'], 'message': 'Fixes ssh-injection error while using chap authentication

A space in the command construction was being caught by the
ssh-injection check. The fix is to separate the command strings.

Change-Id: If1f719f9c2ceff31ed5386c53cf60bc7f522f4d7
Closes-Bug: #1280409
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes ssh-injection error while using chap authentication

A space in the command construction was being caught by the
ssh-injection check. The fix is to separate the command strings.

Change-Id: If1f719f9c2ceff31ed5386c53cf60bc7f522f4d7
Closes-Bug: #1280409

[{'created': '2014-03-05 20:13:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Query for port before calling l3plugin.disassociate_floatingips()

The call to l3plugin.disassociate_floatingips() trigggers several events
that could cause a timeout to occur trying to query the db for the port
therefore this patch changes the code to query first for the port.

commit_message:
Query for port before calling l3plugin.disassociate_floatingips()

The call to l3plugin.disassociate_floatingips() trigggers several events
that could cause a timeout to occur trying to query the db for the port
therefore this patch changes the code to query first for the port.

Closes-bug: #1290478

Change-Id: I69fe9cff4b550240215329e1082a63cd11617faa

Optimize floating IP status update

Hopefully also avoid tracebacks due to nested transactions
being rolled back

subject: remove distros that are out of support by their upstream
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-10 12:42:05.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': "remove distros that are out of support by their upstream

raring EOL was - 27 Jan 2014
f18 EOL was - 14 Jan 2014
opensuse 12.2 was - 15 Jan 2014

if their upstream isn't going to support them, we shouldn't be
in devstack.

this additionally leaves us in an interesting situation that there
is no longer *any* opensuse version listed as supported. if the
opensuse community doesn't step up here we should probably look
at removing it.

Change-Id: Ibb883930b430477dfd3b5126c5db04f95a50d3a7
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
remove distros that are out of support by their upstream

raring EOL was - 27 Jan 2014
f18 EOL was - 14 Jan 2014
opensuse 12.2 was - 15 Jan 2014

if their upstream isn't going to support them, we shouldn't be
in devstack.

this additionally leaves us in an interesting situation that there
is no longer *any* opensuse version listed as supported. if the
opensuse community doesn't step up here we should probably look
at removing it.

Change-Id: Ibb883930b430477dfd3b5126c5db04f95a50d3a7

It doesn't work here for various reasons.

- This code is called before install_infra.

Ryu is not a part of OpenStack anyway.

commit_message:
Stop running setup_devel for Ryu

It doesn't work here for various reasons.
- Ryu's setup.py is incompatible with global requirements
- This code is called before install_infra.

Ryu is not a part of OpenStack anyway.

Closes-Bug: 1287569
Change-Id: I01a942411f7d06bdf8f1fec5d1a0bc319560f329

This patch adds the config options needed to add Queuing tests.
This patch also has a basic test to verify that everything works
as expected.

commit_message:
Call target plugin out of DB transaction in the Metaplugin

Previously, there are cases that a target plugin is called
within a DB transaction in the metaplugin. This possibly causes
"DB lock timeout" error since a target plugin may take a long
time (ex. communicate to a controller).

Change-Id: Ie2971bfae1fecc97086b58cd943c321feb0aba04
Closes-Bug: #1267291

commit_message:
NSX: Add ability to retry on 503's returned by the controller

There are a number of circumstances where the NSX controller
may return 503. Currently the API client does not retry, so
this patch adds a retry logic with timeout.

Closes-bug: #1284277

Change-Id: I85df087d5ae409e6cb5c35eb171e89346abe81f4

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-10 15:25:12.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/create-nodes'], 'message': 'Fix baremetal flavor image size

When storing the node details in the JSON datafile, the DISK size
was incremented for baremetal nodes creation and store after that,
so the baremetal flavor was created with a root disk size bigger
than expected.

Closes-Bug: #1290399
Change-Id: Idc6a3d4f89badeeffb2e17ac84e10cbfa3629de6
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix baremetal flavor image size

When storing the node details in the JSON datafile, the DISK size
was incremented for baremetal nodes creation and store after that,
so the baremetal flavor was created with a root disk size bigger
than expected.

Closes-Bug: #1290399
Change-Id: Idc6a3d4f89badeeffb2e17ac84e10cbfa3629de6

subject: Add missing swift constraint for functional tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-06 05:26:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add missing swift constraint for functional tests

Looks like we are keeping at least four lists of the default
constraints in various places, and when we added the max_header_size
in initial Static Large Object Support commit (5d73da15) we failed to
add it to the two locations in the test tree (test/sample.conf and
test/functional/tests.py).

With this commit we take a small step to consolidate the list of
constraints to the constraints module by removing the list from the
tests module (note we still have them listed in the sample swift.conf
file and the test module's sample.conf file), document the missing
reference in the test module's sample.conf file, and, while we're at
it, use the SWIFT_CONF_FILE reference where possible.

Change-Id: Ic4fa5f1aedec9bc7a7b43ce1a2ca3cdebce6171f
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-03-06 18:10:30.000000000', 'files': ['test/sample.conf', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'swift/common/constraints.py'], 'message': "Add missing swift constraint for functional tests

Looks like we are keeping at least four lists of the default
constraints in various places, and when we added the max_header_size
in initial Static Large Object Support commit (5d73da15) we failed to
add it to the two locations in the test tree (test/sample.conf and
test/functional/tests.py).

With this commit we take a small step to consolidate the list of
constraints to the constraints module by removing the list from the
tests module (note we still have them listed in the sample swift.conf
file and the test module's sample.conf file), document the missing
reference in the test module's sample.conf file, and, while we're at
it, use the SWIFT_CONF_FILE reference where possible.

Change-Id: Ic4fa5f1aedec9bc7a7b43ce1a2ca3cdebce6171f
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add missing swift constraint for functional tests

Looks like we are keeping at least four lists of the default
constraints in various places, and when we added the max_header_size
in initial Static Large Object Support commit (5d73da15) we failed to
add it to the two locations in the test tree (test/sample.conf and
test/functional/tests.py).

With this commit we take a small step to consolidate the list of
constraints to the constraints module by removing the list from the
tests module (note we still have them listed in the sample swift.conf
file and the test module's sample.conf file), document the missing
reference in the test module's sample.conf file, and, while we're at
it, use the SWIFT_CONF_FILE reference where possible.

Change-Id: Ic4fa5f1aedec9bc7a7b43ce1a2ca3cdebce6171f

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-10 13:20:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "libvirt: fix blockinfo get_device_name helper

Currently all the methods in libvirt's blockinfo module will either
be called with block device objects (when attempting to default device
names)  or with a DriverBlockDevice subclass (all other operations in
the virt driver that expect such format to be passed).

This patch updates the get_device_name method to honor the above
situation introduced by I055651b5fd415092787d9487a69467a9bbcf073e.

commit_message:
libvirt: fix blockinfo get_device_name helper

Currently all the methods in libvirt's blockinfo module will either
be called with block device objects (when attempting to default device
names)  or with a DriverBlockDevice subclass (all other operations in
the virt driver that expect such format to be passed).

This patch updates the get_device_name method to honor the above
situation introduced by I055651b5fd415092787d9487a69467a9bbcf073e.

Closes-bug: #1290302
Change-Id: I7099ea4502da2108c4bcba530a8ace173d2dafc9

urlparse netloc contains the TCP port if presents.

commit_message:
TCP port is appended two time in ClientException

urlparse netloc contains the TCP port if presents.
There is no need to provide conn.port when building
CLientException.

commit_message:
Client support for export and import backup service metadata

Add client code to a new admin API for backup-export and
backup-import allowing an admin to copy the backup metadata
details.

client code for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/69351/

blueprint cinder-backup-recover-api
DocImpact new admin API calls backup-import and backup-export

Change-Id: Id306fc9cf562a87bb6a36eae692852eefc592b74

commit_message:
Add missing documentation for enabling oauth1 auth plugin

The oauth1 method and plugin must be declared in keystone.conf for
OS-OAUTH1 to be completely enabled.

Change-Id: I23b479d3cd462ea3823dee0c281a26486f8600ac
Closes-Bug: #1290966

[{'created': '2014-03-11 19:32:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove the docker driver

The docker compute driver does not currently have CI running against
it.  In accordance with our plan to require this for all drivers, we
are now removing the driver from nova.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/HypervisorSupportMatrix/DeprecationPlan

At this point, the driver should be set up in a stackforge repository
and have CI staged from there to prove its reliability before we could
consider bringing it back into Nova.

commit_message:
Remove the docker driver

The docker compute driver does not currently have CI running against
it.  In accordance with our plan to require this for all drivers, we
are now removing the driver from nova.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/HypervisorSupportMatrix/DeprecationPlan

At this point, the driver should be set up in a stackforge repository
and have CI staged from there to prove its reliability before we could
consider bringing it back into Nova.

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I1c9bea2fdeebc4199c4f7d8fca4580a6fb7fed5b

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-17 21:13:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'VPNaaS Device Driver for Cisco CSR

This is the device driver for the vendor specific VPNaaS plugin. This
change relies on the service driver code (review 74144) and Service
Type Framework (client 53602 and server 41827) all out for review.

Open items on this first pathset:
- There is still some refactoring needed in the reporting/syncing code
- Handling of service delete clean-up
- Failure handling (agent restart, RPC failure,...)
- Future: Sharing/tracking of policies (will do if time allows, but
  have workaround in the meantime).
- Update/create Tempest tests to run 3rd party tests for this.

Note: To run, this needs an out-of-band Cisco CSR installed and
      configured.
Note: This uses a newer version of requests library and a new httmock
      library. Need guidance on how to include these.

Change-Id: I4f73f7fa1bfcdc89a35ffe63dd253f8eede98485
Paritally-Implements: blueprint vpnaas-cisco-driver
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-02-20 15:14:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'VPNaaS Device Driver for Cisco CSR

This is the device driver for the vendor specific VPNaaS plugin. This
change relies on the service driver code (review 74144) and Service
Type Framework (client 53602 and server 41827) all out for review.

Rev 2 Has rebase of changes from 74144 and 41827, refactored sync and
repoprting code and revised UTs with better coverage. Added code to
handle failure conditions.

Note: Support for sharing of IKE/IPSec policies (which is currently
      prevented by the service driver code), will be done as a later
      enhancement.

      configured.
Note: This uses a newer version of requests library and a new httmock
      library. Need guidance on how to include these.

Change-Id: I4f73f7fa1bfcdc89a35ffe63dd253f8eede98485

commit_message:
VPNaaS Device Driver for Cisco CSR

This is the device driver for the vendor specific VPNaaS plugin. This
change relies on the service driver code (review 74144), which is also
out for review.

Note: Support for sharing of IKE/IPSec policies (which is currently
      prevented by the service driver code), will be done as a later
      enhancement.
Note: Needs Tempest tests updated/created to test this.
Note: To run, this needs an out-of-band Cisco CSR installed and
      configured.
Note: This uses a newer version of requests library and a new httmock
      library. Until these are approved (75296), the UT will be
      renamed to prevent testing the REST client API to the CSR.

Change-Id: I4f73f7fa1bfcdc89a35ffe63dd253f8eede98485
Paritally-Implements: blueprint vpnaas-cisco-driver

subject: Run overcloud deploy tests against the seed.
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-10 01:02:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Run overcloud deploy tests against the seed.

Currently we deploy the overcloud on the undercloud, but there is no
conceptual benefit to this - the undercloud is meant to be tested
entirely via the undercloud test; the seed is the same code as the
undercloud, differing only in the use of static configuration rather
than heat delivered configuration. Avoiding the undercloud
build-and-deploy makes the overcloud test substantially faster.

Change-Id: Id5895be09ad6728f9d83d260371d02777ee217e8

commit_message:
Run overcloud deploy tests against the seed.

Currently we deploy the overcloud on the undercloud, but there is no
conceptual benefit to this - the undercloud is meant to be tested
entirely via the undercloud test; the seed is the same code as the
undercloud, differing only in the use of static configuration rather
than heat delivered configuration. Avoiding the undercloud
build-and-deploy makes the overcloud test substantially faster.

Change-Id: Id5895be09ad6728f9d83d260371d02777ee217e8

commit_message:
Add constraint to sg rule's remote_ip_prefix

When create or update rules, there is no constraint to remote_ip_prefix,
we can give invalid value such as '--'.

Change-Id: I8c28e814ce6585ff0d9163ad78860a0d0ea39590
Closes-Bug: #1290269

commit_message:
Add TaskManager lock on change port data

Updating port data may require driver actions on the related node
(if address changed for example). New method 'update_port' added
to conductor manager and rpcapi.

Partial-Bug: #1276393
Related-Bug: #1236714
Change-Id: I1f817a8b3c80630f40fd36c82e533d5358225150

subject: Resource type implementations for structured software config
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-18 00:24:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Resource type implementation for structured software config

This resource takes configuration as a Map property and
serializes it either as json or yaml.

This will be used for defining both cfn-init and tripleo software
configuration inline in a template when the author would rather
not have the data specified in a separate file to be pulled in by get_file.

Change-Id: I8029f469dfc2a77453abdab46c1a69ba317fc7ea
