commit_message:
Resource type implementations for structured software config

StructuredConfig takes configuration as a Map property, which
results in config that is stored and returned as a parsed dict.

This will be used for defining both cfn-init and tripleo software
configuration inline in a template as strucured yaml.

StructuredSoftwareDeployment will transform the config to substitute
{"get_input": "<input_name>"} with the current input values and storing
the result in the ephemeral derived config.

partial blueprint hot-software-config

Change-Id: I8029f469dfc2a77453abdab46c1a69ba317fc7ea

subject: Configurable temporary directory for tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-10 00:18:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Configurable temporary directory for tests

The temporary directory used for testing was always
keystone/tests/tmp. This change makes it so that the temporary
directory can be configured by setting the KEYSTONE_TEST_TEMP_DIR
environment variable. For example:

 $ mkdir ~/keystone_test_temp
 $ sudo mount -t tmpfs -o size=16M tmpfs ~/test_dir &&
    sudo chown $USER: ~/test_dir
 $ KEYSTONE_TEST_TEMP_DIR=$HOME/test_dir tox -e py27

Change-Id: I41f86a23882a382ab19747e008720c0da5fd56e6

commit_message:
Configurable temporary directory for tests

The temporary directory used for testing was always
keystone/tests/tmp. This change makes it so that the temporary
directory can be configured by setting the KEYSTONE_TEST_TEMP_DIR
environment variable. For example:

 $ mkdir ~/keystone_test_temp
 $ sudo mount -t tmpfs -o size=16M tmpfs ~/keystone_test_temp &&
    sudo chown $USER: ~/keystone_test_temp
 $ KEYSTONE_TEST_TEMP_DIR=$HOME/keystone_test_temp tox -e py27

Change-Id: I41f86a23882a382ab19747e008720c0da5fd56e6

commit_message:
Fix broken statistics in sqlalchemy

When querying the samples for statistics calculations,
the filtering is done without joining the Sample table.
This patch fixes this.

Closes-Bug: #1289325
Change-Id: I45edc974a6c054d27ac33d5287f760bcff08cf91

commit_message:
Use  a instance lookup helper to v3 plugins

Since I52c15da0499eda676225603d5a0b2739875d1fca, common get_instance() has
been added, the method would make API behaviors consistent.
This patch applies the method to ips and server_diagnostics plugins.

Change-Id: I23c58c43ac9075cedd80b7543ddf8a102d9ee4d5

commit_message:
List filesystem and swift as known glance stores

Glance used to default to include all stores as "known" but has now
switched to only knowing the filesystem store by default. As of
I82073352641d3eb2ab3d6e9a6b64afc99a30dcc7

Change-Id: I10aebbd7c6969c6d95579f3b266e03501a7bedb7
Closes-Bug: #1290969

Use upstream/package keystone-paste.ini.

upstream.

commit_message:
Make some plan types mandatory

This makes artifact_type, requirement_type and service reference id mandatory
It does not make sense to create these objects without the types.

Change-Id: I226b136d5b1844b4d2781bbab2c3c27d8a39a4b6

commit_message:
Generic MixinVendorInterface using static mapping

Use a MixinVendorInterface and a dict for static mapping,
so every method:vendor interface mapping is explicit.

Example:

self.pxe_vendor = pxe.VendorPassthru()
self.ipmi_vendor = ipminative.VendorPassthru()
self.mapping = {'pass_deploy_info': self.pxe_vendor,
	        'set_boot_device': self.ipmi_vendor}
self.vendor = utils.MixinVendorInterface(self.mapping)

Partial-Bug: #1264596

Change-Id: I5dd5a02164670476b0d6ff121bed57569c341a61

commit_message:
Add plan manager and corresponding tests

For m1 we are converting plan yaml file into json. This can be modified to use
yaml itself once we have support for yaml in API layer.

Change-Id: I96f986dde059d66633cbc24797a89619ea5bf52e

commit_message:
Add solum builder client

This client will be used to communicate with builder service from solum.

Generalize KeystoneAuthPlugin so that it can be used by both solumclient and
builder client.

Fixed a bug in solumclient/common/base.py

Change-Id: I86630f40b32c6fcada5aa292fae8e36cecab9908

commit_message:
Destroy all testenv domains

Leaving these running with IP's from previous test runs may cause IP
conflicts and end up in errors booting new instances in devtest runs.
Killing these vm's is only needed while using nova-baremetal as ironic
will assert their state.

Ideally this wouldn't live in boot-seed-vm but its where we currently
kill the seed so it makes sense to keep it together.

Change-Id: I591775f85169d1c454373b19d3a66ba80bf818d3

commit_message:
Update translation setup for cli-reference

The propose_translation_update_manual job did not work since
we needed to initialize some files for it first. I expect that this
fixes the job.

I updates the transifex config to know about cli-refernece and creates
the pot file.

Related-Bug: #1275599
Change-Id: Ib6544fa7545722d61115224a1bb0e51b7ce7c272

commit_message:
Task cleanup_running_deleted_instances can now use slave

Deployments that have a slave_connection configured can offload
read queries generated by this periodic task there. For
deployments with no slave, behavior remains the same.

Partially-implements: blueprint periodic-tasks-to-db-slave
Change-Id: Ie1e6cdfbefab096a2af62ef636786a5c8f659b13

commit_message:
Expose clients directly from osclients.Clients

* Lazy load client handles instead of eager instantiation.
* Update all client handle references to use osclients.Clients.

Change-Id: Iffd17eb37886ca07190d1e2fbb6c02ff6081f69a

This patch adds oslo.messaging to the
CINDER_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_LIBRARIES env variable, which adds
oslo.messaging config options to cinder.conf.sample

Implements blueprint: oslo-messaging

[{'created': '2014-03-11 03:24:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Conductor logs better error if seamicroclient missing

If the driver is installed and the python entrypoint discoverable, but
the external library is not present, the conductor will log exceptions
during startup and remove the *_seamicro drivers from the list of
drivers it advertises support for.

This patch tests the imports and raises one DriverNotFound error for
each affected driver if python-seamicroclient is not installed, instead

Change-Id: I5cde3c3e8c7cbc2bf4991c0ed390ac655dcdbc7c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-03-11 15:13:48.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'ironic/drivers/modules/seamicro.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_seamicro.py', 'ironic/drivers/fake.py', 'ironic/drivers/pxe.py'], 'message': 'Conductor logs better error if seamicroclient missing

If the driver is installed and the python entrypoint discoverable, but
the external library is not present, the conductor will log exceptions
during startup and remove the *_seamicro drivers from the list of
drivers it advertises support for.

This patch tests the imports and raises one DriverNotFound error for
each affected driver if python-seamicroclient is not installed, instead
of raising several ImportErrors.

This also removes python-seamicroclient from requirements.txt

Change-Id: I5cde3c3e8c7cbc2bf4991c0ed390ac655dcdbc7c

commit_message:
Conductor logs better error if seamicroclient missing

If the driver is installed and the python entrypoint discoverable, but
the external library is not present, the conductor will log exceptions
during startup and remove the *_seamicro drivers from the list of
drivers it advertises support for.

This patch tests the imports and raises one DriverNotFound error for
each affected driver if python-seamicroclient is not installed, instead
of raising several ImportErrors.

This also removes python-seamicroclient from requirements.txt

Change-Id: I5cde3c3e8c7cbc2bf4991c0ed390ac655dcdbc7c

commit_message:
Add depends_on key to dependency resolution

The depends_on key was being ignored when calculating resource
dependencies. This patch adds support for the depends_on HOT
keyword.

Change-Id: I7b1dcd841b3491506c9924b59728a1512a6432b7
Closes-Bug: 1288997

commit_message:
Use oslo's config generator to generate sample

This patch adds oslo's config generator to the source tree and uses it
to generate marconi's sample configs. It also adds a check to pep8 that
verifies the config file is up-to-date.

Change-Id: Iec7defa244dc8649a5c832bb81b9ec6f30f0ee37

commit_message:
Prepare Marconi to support oslo's config.generator

This patch removes the options_iter function and prepares marconi's code
base to play nice with oslo's config.generator. The replacement of lists
with tuples is necessary to avoid oslo's config.generator to parse the
globally defined options. In Marconi's case, we want it to use the
registered entry_points. (This is a workaround).

Change-Id: I56995fe16cd0b6e092b522dac3c32e4ec75bb269

Add an options module to sqlalchemy

Let sqla follow the pattern used in other storage drivers. This patch
adds a new options module with a function used by the oslo.config.opts
namespace in the entry_point section.

commit_message:
Ensure stop_nova stops nova-objectstore.

Currently, n-obj is not shutdown with the other services in stop_nova.
This adds it to the list of nova services stopped, ensuring it can be
reliably restarted later.

Change-Id: I49dc04983a59047bddab96db569240cb20136afb

commit_message:
Disable file injection by default

File injection in libvirt is problematic in havana on some systems.
When doing a live upgrade where the system suddenly gains libguestfs
support, a compute node may start using it, and thus start breaking.

Related master branch patch: I5015f2c351b1d680c205d7f9a5204febca490b91

Change-Id: Ic71baa25cda4b65c79c7c5f64bbb802774e489f4
Related-Bug: #1287354

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 7808, 'name': 'Xavier Queralt', 'email': 'xqueralt@gmail.com', 'username': 'xqueralt'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-26 15:26:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt_volume.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py'], 'message': "Unmount the NFS and GlusterFS shares on detach

When attaching an NFS or GlusterFS volume, nova mounts the share so it
can be reused by other instances but it is not unmounted when detaching.

This patch adds the disconnect_volume method to both drivers, which will
try to unmount the share. If a volume in that share is still being used
by another instance, the umount command will fail with the error 'target
is busy' and we will ignore it. Any other error while unmounting will be
properly logged. In any case the detach will fail because nova hasn't
been able to unmount the share.

Closes-Bug: #1285209
Change-Id: I79289524541a88ad359b3465719055cd402b4e3d
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Unmount the NFS and GlusterFS shares on detach

When attaching an NFS or GlusterFS volume, nova mounts the share so it
can be reused by other instances but it is not unmounted when detaching.

This patch adds the disconnect_volume method to both drivers, which will
try to unmount the share. If a volume in that share is still being used
by another instance, the umount command will fail with the error 'target
is busy' and we will ignore it. Any other error while unmounting will be
properly logged. In any case the detach will fail because nova hasn't
been able to unmount the share.

Closes-Bug: #1285209
Change-Id: I79289524541a88ad359b3465719055cd402b4e3d

commit_message:
Set storage engine for the trait_type table

Not setting the storage engine for this table can cause problems in
those MySQL installations whose default storage engine is not InnoDB.

Change-Id: Ifd0ed0ce7698eb840da87e3f393cd223dcfd36e1
Closes-Bug: #1288894

subject: Make config generator function with the duplicate options
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-06 07:45:14.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/config/generator.py'], 'message': "Make config generator function with the duplicate options

If duplicate options are present in the same group, the generator
doesn't properly generate the options.

This patch changes ordering of config options.  It orders based upon
default section, followed by alphabetical ordering by group name.

Within each section, options are ordered alphabetically.

Change-Id: If98d762d592572a1aedb3ba52a55352ca48e567e
Closes-bug: 1288586
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make config generator function with the duplicate options

If duplicate options are present in the same group, the generator
doesn't properly generate the options.

This patch changes ordering of config options.  It orders based upon
default section, followed by alphabetical ordering by group name.

Within each section, options are ordered alphabetically.

Change-Id: If98d762d592572a1aedb3ba52a55352ca48e567e
Closes-bug: 1288586

commit_message:
Add Storage Policy Support to ssync

This patch makes ssync policy aware and adds plumbing required
for existing test cases to pass as well as required tests to
assure policy support coverage.

Change-Id: Ib846b23c47108610a8511a7f910a7d8d09ffe337

commit_message:
ensure => absent must remove the mon data dir

Instead of moving it to another directory because it prevents running
three or more mon installation / destruction in sequence on the same
machine.

Change-Id: I418c2fdcd35ff0bc1cc258d069516f870807cdbe
Signed-off-by: Loic Dachary <loic@dachary.org>

commit_message:
Revert "Don't enable all stores by default"

This reverts commit 1f6381a73f5c99f1f731d6c4f9defb91bd2d042d

The reverted change will break all users of glance with swift backends on upgrade, as this changes the default.

Closes-Bug: #1290969

commit_message:
Don't enable all stores by default

Glance currently enables all stores by default. This patch changes that
by removing all stores that require manual configuration and leaving
those that work right out of the box.

Current behavior causes a lot of confusion to users since most of those
stores print errors when they're not configured correctly. All extra
stores should be enabled explicitly by users.

This fix makes tests use http locations. All other locations besides the
default ones should be tested in their own test suites.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1255556
Change-Id: I82073352641d3eb2ab3d6e9a6b64afc99a30dcc7

commit_message:
Add instructions for "normal" user creation

Added instructions for adding a "normal" user named "demo" with access
to the dashboard but no administrative functions. Restructured the
section into procedures to support this and make the task split
clearer.

Change-Id: Iebfec133e44447fad2149ea815c749468b57c763
Closes-Bug: #1266391

Changing the savannadashboard directory to saharadashboard

Changing the savannadashboard directory to saharadashboard along
with the derivitive changes (all places where that package was
referenced).  This is another work item that is part of renaming
savanna to sahara.

commit_message:
Correct iso8601 parseing invalid year num

iso8601 should raise reasonable error when parsing timestamp with invalid
years. This is implemented in iso8601 version 0.1.9.
More details please see the bug description and the issue on bitbucket.

Change-Id: I23ec6a125110294f49eb55ced02ff4e5965a0b99
Closes-Bug: #1266398

commit_message:
Separate action and creation tests in tempest

Update of tempest plugin to separate share tests,
that:
1) cover functionality of creation/deletion
2) cover functionality of actions over entities

Change-Id: I0738c2bc0d07f9450b3fd22756766767cbfdb13a

commit_message:
Use a colon instead of a . in setup.cfg

Mistakenly, the commit that added the oslo.config.opts entry_points used
a `.` before the final function instead of a `:`. This commit fixes
that.

Change-Id: I305cfe9067640bb91ce30e5f13c540931de800a6

commit_message:
Sync from oslo-incubator

This patch is intended to bring in `config.generator`. It also syncs
Marconi's modules to the latest oslo-incubator version for the sake of
being up-to-date.

Change-Id: I9cd3ccf0ce509349d561132025add42dec83ca0a

Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Driver configuration details.

commit_message:
Add tempest test for heat resource OS::Nova::KeyPair

The template will create two OS::Nova::KeyPair and will test that:
   [*] The key with save_private_key flag set to true outputs both
       public and private keys.
   [*] The key with save_private_key flag set to false outputs
       only the public key.

Testing other cases will require to recreate the stack and
include a negative test case.

Change-Id: I751a85e0efd997a1238c53d8802ebdd8b551e7aa
Partial-Bug: #1271995

commit_message:
fix(cli): Print statement in global error handler

This is the last place we could be writing to stderr from our code. It
seems unlikely this is the root cause of the devstack issue, since our
monkey-patch test should have turned this up, but let's remove it to
be absolutely certain.

Change-Id: Id454d9affcf060d5308f965e25119693ec790624
Partial-Bug: #1287490

commit_message:
Make the path in neutron.conf configurable

Make the path in neutron.conf configurable, in some cases like
if we want to use this cookbook's template to support installation
of neutron agent on windows platform.

commit_message:
Add MySQL-python as a dependency

This is required for the sqlalchemy driver. We can argue whether it is
needed as a default dependency or completely optional but as of now, I'd
recommend having it as a hard dependency and relaxing it later.

Change-Id: I43df1e9f7386888a354119b659d4de3bc69d3b46

commit_message:
Support passing 'neutron_insecure' to neutronclient

When using a self-signed certificate for the network service endpoint,
the metadata agent has to pass the 'insecure' flag to neutronclient.
Otherwise requests will fail due to the failed certificate validity
check.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1269740
Change-Id: I091b1620ab60184921cc12e038af5d717d4d476f

Currently if you are working in an environment that cannot reach the target openstack-ppa uri/components,
say you do not have internet access for instance, you will see an error in the log which is captured in the refferenced bug report.

The user should be able to set default['openstack']['apt']['components'] = nil or []  to avoid this error but doing so leads to another exception.

This patch intended to avoid executing an unnesessary code path by checking first checking if this attribute is nil or empty prior to attempting to fetch updates.

Fixes bug 1289356

commit_message:
Fix unnecessary error messages in log

Currently if you are working in an environment that cannot reach the
target openstack-ppa uri/components,say you do not have internet access
for instance, you will see an error in the log which is captured in
the refferenced bug report.

By adding a new flag attribute:
['openstack']['apt']['live_updates_enabled'], the opnstack ppa update
can be disabled by setting this attribute to false.

This patch intended to avoid executing an unnesessary code path by
checking the new flag  prior to attempting to fetch updates.

Closes-Bug: #1289356
Change-Id: Ifca7c77e7a84834b88600c14d5a45cc0a64825f8

commit_message:
Adds https support for metadata agent

Adds two configure options to support https client for metadata proxy
* auth_insecure: turn off verification of the certificate for ssl, or
* auth_ca_cert: CA cert to check against with for ssl.

Change-Id: I3ffb86ae9ce31931436a4e13957aae30eebf9d92
Closes-Bug: #1263872

subject: Make ceilometer work with sqla 0.9.x
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-10 22:40:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make ceilometer work with sqla 0.9.x

Ceilometer's migration 028 makes some very specific assumptions
about sqla data structures and exception paths, which are not
true in sqla 0.9.x. In 0.8 you were shielded from errors on drop
by sqla, but in 0.9 you get raw exceptions from the db layer
thrown all the way up, which causes a failure condition when
trying to delete the non existent alembic table.

Fix this by checking whether the table exists. In future the
migrations shouldn't touch so many sqla internals.

Change-Id: Ida33a3030fb03c2f3eeed9f129fcc0063a7b7c4b
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-03-11 10:51:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make ceilometer work with sqla 0.9.x

Ceilometer's migration 028 makes some very specific assumptions
about sqla data structures and exception paths, which are not
true in sqla 0.9.x. In 0.8 you were shielded from errors on drop
by sqla, but in 0.9 you get raw exceptions from the db layer
thrown all the way up, which causes a failure condition when
trying to delete the non existent alembic table.

We can get basically the same behavior as before by using the
checkfirst=True parameter on table definitions. This will
actually ensure that we get the table in question, and get the
NoSuchTableError when we expect it.

Change-Id: Ida33a3030fb03c2f3eeed9f129fcc0063a7b7c4b
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-03-11 11:38:57.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/028_alembic_migrations.py'], 'message': "Make ceilometer work with sqla 0.9.x

Ceilometer's migration 028 makes some very specific assumptions
about sqla data structures and exception paths, which are not
true in sqla 0.9.x. In 0.8 you were shielded from errors on drop
by sqla, but in 0.9 you get raw exceptions from the db layer
thrown all the way up, which causes a failure condition when
trying to delete the non existent alembic table.

We can get basically the same behavior as before by using the
checkfirst=True parameter on table definitions. This will
actually ensure that we get the table in question, and get the
NoSuchTableError when we expect it.

Change-Id: Ida33a3030fb03c2f3eeed9f129fcc0063a7b7c4b
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Make ceilometer work with sqla 0.9.x

Ceilometer's migration 028 makes some very specific assumptions
about sqla data structures and exception paths, which are not
true in sqla 0.9.x. In 0.8 you were shielded from errors on drop
by sqla, but in 0.9 you get raw exceptions from the db layer
thrown all the way up, which causes a failure condition when
trying to delete the non existent alembic table.

We can get basically the same behavior as before by using the
checkfirst=True parameter on table definitions. This will
actually ensure that we get the table in question, and get the
NoSuchTableError when we expect it.

Change-Id: Ida33a3030fb03c2f3eeed9f129fcc0063a7b7c4b

Recent pyOpenSSL releases when installed from pip depend on

with the python-cffi (0.7.2) package on openSUSE-13.1 which is required by the

Change-Id: I721ce5288d150a3b01fb2558f7ca86028d734138
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use the python-pyOpenSSL package openSUSE

Recent pyOpenSSL releases when installed from pip depend on
cryptography>=0.2.1, which itself depends on cffi>=0.8. That is conflicting
with the python-cffi (0.7.2) package on openSUSE-13.1 which is required by the
installed python-xattr.

Change-Id: I721ce5288d150a3b01fb2558f7ca86028d734138

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9369, 'name': 'Steve Kowalik', 'email': 'steven@wedontsleep.org', 'username': 'stevenk'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

commit_message:
Delete ERROR+DELETING VMs during compute startup.

We should perhaps do this check during message bus reconnection as
well.. Anyhow, if a compute node is offline during a nova API call
to delete an instance, and the rabbit message is lost for some
reason (or alternatively if the delete method throws an error)
then the task state is not cleared and won't be cleared on compute
restart, leaving it wedged forever.

Change-Id: Ie0a47958eb0fb58307902437a95634d5f54f74f3
Fixes-bug: #1281324
Co-Authored-By: Steve Kowalik <steven@wedontsleep.org>

subject: remove rspec-system dependencies from Gemfile
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-11 08:03:16.000000000', 'files': ['Gemfile-rspec-system', 'Gemfile', 'README.md'], 'message': "remove rspec-system dependencies from Gemfile

rspec-system will fail to install on jenkins slaves. It does not matter
anyway since it is not going to be used for unit tests. Create a
Gemfile-rspec-system to be used when running integration tests. Although
it would be convenient to be able to

   BUNDLE_GEMFILE=Gemfile-rspec-system bundle exec rake spec:system

it will fail because the environment variable won't be propagated where
it should.

   .rspec_system/vagrant_projects/x64/Gemfile-rspec-system not found

The README.md file is updated to simply mv to Gemfile which is good
enough for the environment running the integration tests.

A bug was filed against openstack-ci to resolve this installation
problem but it is unclear if and how it could be fixed
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ci/+bug/1290710

Change-Id: I0bff624892837536419bdbdd6651b009600fe9c6
Signed-off-by: Loic Dachary <loic@dachary.org>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
remove rspec-system dependencies from Gemfile

rspec-system will fail to install on jenkins slaves. It does not matter
anyway since it is not going to be used for unit tests. Create a
Gemfile-rspec-system to be used when running integration tests. Although
it would be convenient to be able to

   BUNDLE_GEMFILE=Gemfile-rspec-system bundle exec rake spec:system

it will fail because the environment variable won't be propagated where
it should.

   .rspec_system/vagrant_projects/x64/Gemfile-rspec-system not found

The README.md file is updated to simply mv to Gemfile which is good
enough for the environment running the integration tests.

A bug was filed against openstack-ci to resolve this installation
problem but it is unclear if and how it could be fixed
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ci/+bug/1290710

Change-Id: I0bff624892837536419bdbdd6651b009600fe9c6
Signed-off-by: Loic Dachary <loic@dachary.org>

commit_message:
Factor out _update_db_object method in handlers

The update method is now moved to the db object.
That way, if solum is accessed by something else than the
handlers, it still works fine

Closes bug 1282616
https://bugs.launchpad.net/solum/+bug/1282616

Change-Id: I90430588c666a1d5c8ea6801c92facb059f47296

commit_message:
Hide date picker fields in Resources Usage Overview by default

Date picker fields (From, To) in Admin > Resources Usage Overview panel
should be visible only when "Other" is selected in Period drop down. Since
when the panel loads the default drop down selection is "Last week" these
date picker fields should be hidden by default. This patch fixes the issue
where these fields are displayed very briefly when the panel loads and then
are hidden.

Closes-Bug: #1280423

Change-Id: Iffdcec2c0c957f768f7e9331041a898c61cb2ef3

commit_message:
Add Cinder tests for quota sets

This commit adds client for the Cinder quota API and adds
tests to list and update the quotas.

Change-Id: Ic53dbf6e6ef26c4275039091fc4db6a63f796dba
Closes-Bug: #1252774

commit_message:
Fix ml2 db migration of subnetroutes table

The ml2 db migration path doesn't create subnetroutes table. Therefore
installations were partially relying on automatic schema generation.

This patch fixes the migration path.

Change-Id: I3060dd9538b629ad7277af28008ddde27926dcc4
Closes-Bug: #1290255

commit_message:
VMware vSphere support: Memory Usage

1) Added vSphere Hypervisor inspector.
2) Implemented memory usage pollster to generate memory usage samples
for vSphere VMs.

Change-Id: I2aab2fdbc9d0ff4ccf8553bac19c44e463e6595a
Implements: blueprint vmware-vcenter-server

commit_message:
Added option for test of transient cluster

* Option to run only test for transient cluster was added;
* In addition, backslashes for line breaks were removed (http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#maximum-line-length).

Change-Id: Ia567c47820c916d6d4c1e8be95cc1d36723242e5

subject: Block setuptools 3.0 to workaround a cffi bug
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-06 18:34:07.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Block setuptools 3.0 to workaround a cffi bug

setuptools 3.0 removed the Feature class which breaks at least the cffi
project. cffi is indirectly needed by nova. Keep setuptools 2.2 until cffi is
fixed.

https://bitbucket.org/pypa/setuptools/issue/65
https://bitbucket.org/cffi/cffi/issue/139/

Change-Id: I166aa679bcec79afdaf013b8f393957f849d4daf
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Block setuptools 3.0 to workaround a cffi bug

setuptools 3.0 removed the Feature class which breaks at least the cffi
project. cffi is indirectly needed by nova. Keep setuptools 2.2 until cffi is
fixed.

https://bitbucket.org/pypa/setuptools/issue/65
https://bitbucket.org/cffi/cffi/issue/139/

Change-Id: I166aa679bcec79afdaf013b8f393957f849d4daf

subject: Correct the return of diagnosing stopped instance
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-07 09:24:01.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v1_1/shell.py', 'novaclient/v3/shell.py'], 'message': 'Correct the return of diagnosing stopped instance

When diagnosing a stopped instance, the nova CLI return a incorrect
message.
It should return nothing to confirm to nova API.

Change-Id: I59b28193e5731089ebb8bc2c9a53bbc8b43155e3
Closes-bug: #1289079
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Correct the return of diagnosing stopped instance

When diagnosing a stopped instance, the nova CLI return a incorrect
message.
It should return nothing to confirm to nova API.

Change-Id: I59b28193e5731089ebb8bc2c9a53bbc8b43155e3
Closes-bug: #1289079

commit_message:
Run hacking and flake checks for real

Previous tox configuration didn't run any of hacking or flake8 checks. This
commit enables both. Here are details:
* Added hacking to test-requirements. It'll manage it's own dependencies -
  pep8, pyflakes, and flake8
* Enabled flake8
* Disabled a bunch of hacking and flake rules. They should be fixed in next
  dependend patches
* Removed unused test dependency - pysendfiles

Change-Id: I8dcbd4da6d0ced7e9f6a5a760020cbefa62657e9

commit_message:
Replace more then just "-" in REPONAME

Looks like shells only support alphanumeric characters and "_"'s in
environment variables. We were substituting "-" characters but in
order to be able to set overrides in projects with names containing
other characters we need to substitute more, I'm looking at you
oslo.config.

Change-Id: I3e2b1b0bc5871e4ec4ffd8117906cd077aa2cb0d
Co-authored-by: James Polley <jp@jamezpolley.com>

commit_message:
Modify timeout in client shell

this parameter is not only available in creation,
but also update and deletion.

- use '-t' '--timeout' to set this parameter in shell
- modify parameter document

Change-Id: I8ec3c63e9de2c650e9018ad93562159a064e9356

commit_message:
Fix comparison with singletons in unit tests

Several places in the code use assertEqual(None, x) or
assertNotEqual(None, x).

As comparison to singletons must use `is` operator, appropriate usage
was changed to assertIsNone, assertIsNotNone

Change-Id: I7188f178d6db4dc4314860961d51e35447ed59c4

commit_message:
N1kv: Fixes fields argument not None

N1kv plugin includes 'fields' in call to get_<resource> function in
superclass. This can trigger errors if other fields are used in the
subsequent processing in the N1kv plugin's own get_<resource>
function.

Change-Id: I63687a830579a178c6daaa2b8f71bef7eb53d584
Closes-bug: #1285289

commit_message:
the check for status.status should happen before trying to log it

otherwise, if status.status is None, status.status.api_status will throw
a TypeError

Closes-Bug: #1287097
Change-Id: I62dafed59dcf8850808b22b8977d346607176403

commit_message:
VMware: Take the volume size from the user input

When we create a volume from an image or a snapshot, we need to
take the size of the volume from the user input and validate whether
the size is appropriate instead of taking the image size as the
volume size directly.

Change-Id: If09933d8ffa989c4dacc0860c19ea332bc21092a
Closes-Bug: #1237557

Removed teardown method from image test

Here Removed the teardown method as the
base class is deleting the images.

commit_message:
Add state check when suspend or resume stack

If suspend a stack which is already suspended,
some resource will throw exceptions.and you can't
suspend or resume that failed resource.

Add stack check when update or resume,if the
state of stack is expecter,return directly.

Change-Id: Ie6859c03168d9d18e88bbeb6df2c646541f2aa9d
Closes-Bug: 1284531

it again.

commit_message:
Increases timeout for guest agent resize_fs

When the guest agent resizes the file system, it may take longer
than the AGENT_LOW_TIMEOUT and should use AGENT_HIGH_TIMEOUT to
ensure the resize has sufficient time to complete.

Change-Id: Ic3c030f60ca47d894eb25b83f05b63ef22d519f8
Closes-Bug: #1288766

subject: Account for stack_user_project_id in stack_get_by_name
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-11 00:35:37.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/tests/test_sqlalchemy_api.py'], 'message': "Account for stack_user_project_id in stack_get_by_name

stack_get compares the context tenant to the stack tenant
and the stack_user_project_id. stack_get_by_name only filters
by tenant, so identify_stack fails when looking up by stack name
and the stack_user_project_id is the context tenant (such as when
there is a cfn API describe resource call).

This change searches for tenant or stack_user_project_id for
stack_get_by_name and stack_get_by_name_and_owner_id. It also
extends the tests to ensure a stack is returned when
stack_user_project_id matches, and no stack is returned when
tenant doesn't match.

Closes-Bug: #1288523
Change-Id: I875e232a791c71a4ad55a0e4e5a1423ec3546119
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Account for stack_user_project_id in stack_get_by_name

stack_get compares the context tenant to the stack tenant
and the stack_user_project_id. stack_get_by_name only filters
by tenant, so identify_stack fails when looking up by stack name
and the stack_user_project_id is the context tenant (such as when
there is a cfn API describe resource call).

This change searches for tenant or stack_user_project_id for
stack_get_by_name and stack_get_by_name_and_owner_id. It also
extends the tests to ensure a stack is returned when
stack_user_project_id matches, and no stack is returned when
tenant doesn't match.

Closes-Bug: #1288523
Change-Id: I875e232a791c71a4ad55a0e4e5a1423ec3546119

commit_message:
Call an existing method in sync cache for revoke events

The cache used for synchronizing the revocation tree across
green threads had an issue where it was calling a non-existant
method ``remove`` instead of ``remove_event``. The correct method
is now being called and an expanded test to exercise the synchronize
method has been added.

Change-Id: I3fe47fa51f88aab89480831b2d95746319f82ceb
Closes-Bug: 1289935

commit_message:
Update oslo-incubator db module

Changes -
 * db: move all options into database group
 * Make TRADITIONAL the default SQL mode
 * Introduce mysql_sql_mode option, remove old warning
 * Mark files graduating to oslotest
 * Fix a small typo in api.py
 * Update oslo log messages with translation domains

Change-Id: I3af511bbbc2565c5748d1f47d29cd1c5047d3e26

commit_message:
Update oslo-incubator db.sqlalchemy module

Changes -
 * Add from_config() method to EngineFacade
 * Introduce mysql_sql_mode option, remove old warning
 * Introduce a method to set any MySQL session SQL mode
 * Handle ibm_db_sa DBDuplicateEntry integrity errors
 * Fix migration.db_version when no tables
 * Update log translation domains
 * Add model_query() to db.sqlalchemy.utils module
 * Remove None for dict.get()
 * Fix duplicating of SQL queries in logs
 * Update oslo log messages with translation domains

Change-Id: I654acad217e552e64283e93ef884d5cd8dea58da

commit_message:
Show the service id for service-list command

Current service-list command does not show each service id.
Nova contains a RESTful API to delete a service with the specified id.
This patch adds the service id column to use the id in the above case.

Change-Id: I616573c6d5b7e922a6c79d92752a19f65cca00d5

commit_message:
Use multiprocessing in UserGenerator for creating tenants and users.

Create each tenant and its users in separate process to save performance.

Notes:
  * single keystone client is used for each process
  * tenants IDs and users IDs are saved in UserGenerator instance instead of their instances,
    to avoid keystone client manager issue (recursion is caused by keystoneclient.base.Resource.__getattr__)

Blueprint conrurrent-creation-of-users

Change-Id: I484a9351c53c98a33712d19d28c651535e637e47

commit_message:
Ensure localcontext can be monkeypatched

_STORE must be instanciated at first use, not at module loading time,
to ensure eventlet can monkeypatch the threading module before the
creation of the threading.local() object

Closes-bug: #1288878

Change-Id: Iea34a28463e91aeba125d8742c4b886fa84a3c35

commit_message:
Fixed _error_checker in rest client

Restclient's method '_error_checker' for response codes 500 and 501 gets key
error exception when 'resp_body' is a string and passes conditions for
containing of keys.
Also added fix to rarely raised Exceptions after separation main and base
exceptions for two modules.

Closes-Bug: #1280767
Closes-Bug: #1289190
Partially-implements: bp unit-tests
Change-Id: I4b909d008940f8a96efc922daac64a086819c78a

commit_message:
Handle not found exceptions in update_floatingip_status()

Update_status may come from agent on a floating ip which was
already deleted from db - need to handle such cases properly

Change-Id: Idfa240f8dcb0a2e5c2a97b0f168bf1ba2d7dc50f
Closes-Bug: #1287049

Fix state modifying catalog tests

Some of the service catalog tests modify the global state. They should
take a copy of the dictionary before modifying it.

commit_message:
rename and fix the db_wipe command

* rename db_wipe to db_recreate
* make --repo-path an optional argument for db_wipe and use it
* add command line help strings for db_wipe

Closes-Bug: #1279734

Change-Id: I1a1d3ad56989026fb10f6c57bb479814dc51328e

subject: Remove Min/Max for Configuration Group Booleans
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-06 02:48:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix for boolean configuration parameters

Issues:
Boolean configuration parameters are treated as integers and have to
specify min(0)/max(1) values for boolean params.
If cli -> trove configuration-create configparams '{"logappend":false}',
then cli -> trove show <configuration>, would still print it as cli ->
values | {u'logappend': False}. False instead of false.
This is due to Python upcasing booleans. Expected behavior is it should
print boolean params as true/false instead of True/False.

Fixes:
This change fixes the above mentioned issues.

Closes-Bug: #1288507
Change-Id: I2d7556621e891b22291c7ef9e9c523e1ce98a047
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-03-10 03:55:13.000000000', 'files': ['trove/configuration/service.py'], 'message': 'Remove Min/Max for Configuration Group Booleans

boolean configuration-group parameters at the moment require a
min/max value of 0/1 to work around some faulty logic that is
meant to validate integer values, but instead validates integer
and boolean values.

Closes-Bug: #1288507
Change-Id: I2d7556621e891b22291c7ef9e9c523e1ce98a047
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Remove Min/Max for Configuration Group Booleans

boolean configuration-group parameters at the moment require a
min/max value of 0/1 to work around some faulty logic that is
meant to validate integer values, but instead validates integer
and boolean values.

Closes-Bug: #1288507
Change-Id: I2d7556621e891b22291c7ef9e9c523e1ce98a047

subject: Fixed backup unittests to use mocked cmd
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-11 00:37:25.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/backup/test_backupagent.py'], 'message': 'Fixed backup unittests to use mocked cmd

The backup unittests were using the actual cmd from the backup
implementation (eg. innobackupex) instead of the faked unit test
cmd. Fixed this so that calls to innobackupex are no longer being
made when running the unit tests.

Closes-bug: 1290290
Change-Id: I26b77efbf95feb5a32777197c7cba08f7b757c38
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixed backup unittests to use mocked cmd

The backup unittests were using the actual cmd from the backup
implementation (eg. innobackupex) instead of the faked unit test
cmd. Fixed this so that calls to innobackupex are no longer being
made when running the unit tests.

Closes-bug: 1290290
Change-Id: I26b77efbf95feb5a32777197c7cba08f7b757c38

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-10 21:11:38.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/lib/manila'], 'message': "Make functions in manila uniquenamed

Manila's devstack plugin has samenamed functions as in
cinder. It makes problems using cinder with manila's installation.
All function names should be unique.

Change-Id: I32fa7aecc7b74692b60c040cabd371f1499c21e6
Closes-Bug: #1290552
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make functions in manila uniquenamed

Manila's devstack plugin has samenamed functions as in
cinder. It makes problems using cinder with manila's installation.
All function names should be unique.

Change-Id: I32fa7aecc7b74692b60c040cabd371f1499c21e6
Closes-Bug: #1290552

commit_message:
Modify API tests to check the calls

Since often mocked response is returned untouched by the tested
function, we need to check not only that it returns the proper
response, but also that it makes a right request too.

Change-Id: I87bf79d9c8648f8377c0c27b1cd4992a6e5af598
Closes-Bug: #1288169

commit_message:
Use oslo.messaging for AMQP communications

Ported task executor to oslo.messaging. The executor module is
replaced with RPC server/client named Executor and ExecutorClient
respectively to handle task execution. The old executor module is
deleted.  The engine is modified to use the ExecutorClient to send
task requests over the transport to the Executor. The launcher is
modified to start the new Executor.

Change-Id: Ibce01813e51c2220c45e05bb820b4729027446a3
Implements: blueprint mistral-oslo-messaging

commit_message:
Fixed creation of cinder's volumes

Manila's function "_configure_tgt_for_config_d"
was imported second and was redefining cinder's
with same name. It caused absense of cinder.conf for
tgt.

Change-Id: I259994b337f857a3f71a37f91e71bbe2543d0815
Closes-Bug: #1290516

commit_message:
Instances are not stuck in BACKUP

Fixed the backup running states, so that a NEW state is no longer
considered running. This means that Instances are not stuck in
BACKUP unless they are actively performing a backup.

Closes-bug: 1252897
Change-Id: Ia9be9f19d695a66bcc2a9b952584139652d97773

->2. clients

It is very useful for new projects, who can just place
needed files into appropriate dirs without changing
tempest core files.
Much less merge conflicts and separation of base classes and
child classes.

Change-Id: Ib4f5b7004d86a4a194a7bd93905d6b7b12e07801

commit_message:
Implement pluggability for tempest (clients)

Third patch of three patches:
  1. exceptions
  2. config (+ module_utils.py)
->3. clients

It is very useful for new projects, who can just place
needed files into appropriate dirs without changing
tempest core files.
Much less merge conflicts and separation of base classes and
child classes.

Partially-implements: bp make-tempest-pluggable

Change-Id: Ib4f5b7004d86a4a194a7bd93905d6b7b12e07801

commit_message:
Add "list fping servers" tests for Nova V2 api

This commit adds tests for Nova V2 API:
    'GET os-fping'
NOTE: This API is only in Nova V2. So we don't need this for Nova V3.

commit_message:
Add -N option to force using the local environment

Add the -N option to force using the local environement and not creating
a new virtualenv. Unlike other OpenStack project this option is default
in heat, we add it to match what other projects are doing and make it
easier to maintain integration scripts for packagers.

Partial-Bug: #1273598
Change-Id: I3b84613ef30926a1dd5e979278a615c0f11c0cde

commit_message:
VPNaaS integration with service type framework

* adds new attribute 'provider' for vpnservice
* adds support for multiple drivers for vpn

Implements blueprint vpn-service-types-integration
DocImpact

Change-Id: I9e195dfaee21b1cf204cb9b9fc773bc9e5af5936

commit_message:
resource-list fails on a stack with ResourceGroup

The ResourceGroup does not have nested resources. This causes a
an AttributeError when doing a resource-list.

Co-Authored-By: Keith Bray <keith.bray@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: I5428f4ea9e935b29a81f9a9cd8e7536d427f4cce
Closes-Bug: #1280391

In the event of a unrecoverable hardware failure, support needs to
relocate an instance to another compute so it can be rebuilt.

'host' field is not sent in the request, the scheduler
will determine the target host. This will include

this new optional parameter.

commit_message:
Add APIv3 support to make host optional on evacuate.

In the event of an unrecoverable hardware failure, support needs to
relocate an instance to another compute so it can be rebuilt.
  [*] Bump v3 version of evacuate to set host argument optional.

DocImpact: The evacuate target host is now optional. If
'host' field is not sent in the request, the scheduler
will determine the target host. This will include
nova client changes ( on the proper commit ) to support
this new optional parameter.

   the oslo generator script)
 * manage a list of blacklisted modules (only one module needs blacklisting at
   the moment)

Handle some special cases that make the script fail:

 * only import modules that explicitely define oslo.config options (inspired by
   the oslo generator script)
 * manage a list of options that need to be explicitely registered (they
   otherwise need code execution, which we cannot do)

Try to discover and include options that are not registered on module import but
when actually executing the code.

We find calls to register_opts() that cannot be handled on import, extract the

Change-Id: I4566b68b59d5a7a1e15cbd3fb9fcec1a51f9abac
', 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
Handle options not registered on module import

Try to discover and include options that are not registered on module import but
when actually executing the code.

We find calls to register_opts() that cannot be handled on import, extract the
arguments and explicitly call register_opt() to make oslo.config aware of them.

Change-Id: I4566b68b59d5a7a1e15cbd3fb9fcec1a51f9abac

subject: Stop using generator._list_opts; use cfg.CONF instead
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-07 20:58:54.000000000', 'files': ['autogenerate_config_docs/autohelp.py', 'autogenerate_config_docs/common.py'], 'message': "Stop using generator._list_opts; use cfg.CONF instead

We don't use the information about defining module anywhere. Using
that routine just makes the code slower and causes crashes in Neutron
and possibly elsewhere whenever an option is defined in the top level
but not registered.

Change-Id: I946c740cd0ce6fa5d969964d79a75a406e8453ab
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stop using generator._list_opts; use cfg.CONF instead

We don't use the information about defining module anywhere. Using
that routine just makes the code slower and causes crashes in Neutron
and possibly elsewhere whenever an option is defined in the top level
but not registered.

Change-Id: I946c740cd0ce6fa5d969964d79a75a406e8453ab

commit_message:
Prepare for enabling H302 rule (api/compute/admin)

We can use H302 rule but ignore it now. This commit prepares for
enabling H302 rule. But this commit modifies a part of Tempest only
because if we fix all of them at one time, it's hard to merge this
commit.

    ---------------
    tempest/api/compute/admin     <- This patch
    tempest/api/compute/{c*,f*,i*,s*,t*}
    tempest/api/compute/{v3,volumes},data_processing
    tempest/api/identity/admin
    tempest/api/image
    tempest/api/{n*,o*,t*}
    tempest/api/volume,tempest/*
    tempest/services/compute/json
    tempest/services/compute/v3/json
    tempest/services/compute/xml
    tempest/services/identity
    tempest/services/{im*,n*,o*,t*}
    tempest/services/volume
    tempest/clients.py: TBD
    ---------------

Change-Id: Id993c8b157c0b1256aa17c2b8e8f8da46111c521

spawn and resize. As spawn wants to resize the root disk, resize=True
during the spawn operation.

commit_message:
xenapi: fix spawn servers with ephemeral disks

The new resize ephemeral disk code uses vdis["ephemerals"] to pass the
list of ephemeral vdis to the resize disk code. This is shared between
spawn and resize. As spawn wants to resize the root disk, resize=True
during the spawn operation.

The code in _attach_disks correctly deals with empty ephemeral disks,
but the code in _resize_up_vdis did not, and failed due to
ephemeral_vdis being None.

This is a quick fix for the issue. We need some refactoring in this area
so there is, ideally, only one place that generates ephemeral disks.

Change-Id: If058c5c17c2ed76569fd98d4a3d8e5274721fbd0
Closes-Bug: #1289361

commit_message:
Fix the argument indents of flavors_extraspecs

952a26a851ed11d157dba926349472cdac00155b has used db.flavor_ instead
of db.instance_type_ but it has not fitted the argument indents.
This patch fixes them for cleanup.

Change-Id: Icba1ce66582d0ed4f8100854ec9e50552419f5af

commit_message:
Fix lack of extended port's attributes in Metaplugin

Previously, there are some extended port's attributes did not
appear in the result of GET port API when using Metaplugin.
This become a critial issue currently since lack of port binding
information disturbs normal port binding operation in a compute
node, for example.

Metaplugin did not delegate get_port/get_ports to target plugins.
This is cause of the problem because right plugin instance is not
passed to a hook which handles extended attributes.
Now, get_port/get_ports of target plugins are called so that
extended port's attributes are handled properly.

Change-Id: Ifed2505a97ceca56c4cedd22efa49adcdf3317b8
Closes-Bug: #1136252

commit_message:
Add App Detail page

This patch added a new App Details page to App Catalog.
Right now it uses fake model application but
UI render part is complete.
There is no error handling here yet, it should be
added later.
The main purpose of this prototype is to define
an API methods we will need to render UI.
This stuff do not cover Icons yet.

Change-Id: I6ae9f76ac9db88e7918a1fa5add5632b0865985f

commit_message:
Add tiles view for App Catalog

This patch adds a main view for App Catalog.
This is a first draft of App Catalog page based
on tiles approach. App Catalog page has two
sections:
Latest Apps - the newest? or probably last used by his user
App List a list of apps with pagination and category filter.

Change-Id: I70d2ab25bfc13a0aa410f808aaac11050db38242

tempest.common.log.TestsFormatter formatter was removed from the tempest
repository. It makes the current sample config file useless.
We will use the same ContextFormatter in the sample config as we use in the
normal runs.

The tempest.log file will be appended, instead of replacing.
The summary of the stress runs will be printed to the stdout.

The syslog handler preserved in the sample config, but it is not in use
anymore. If someone want to use, he can enable it by little change.

logging config, if you would like to use special log related
configuration.

commit_message:
Stress runner friendly logging.conf.sample

tempest.common.log.TestsFormatter formatter was removed from the tempest
repository. It makes the current sample config file useless.
We will use the same ContextFormatter in the sample config as we use in the
normal runs.

The tempest.log file will be appended, instead of replacing.
The summary of the stress runs will be printed to the stdout.

The syslog handler preserved in the sample config, but it is not in use
anymore. If someone want to use, he can enable it by little change.

NOTE:
You need change tempest.conf [DEFAULT]/log_config_append to point a valid
logging config, if you would like to use special log related
configuration.

Change-Id: Ic6ede3943e309a102d4af6dec505f0d4cbd3bc2b

commit_message:
Add Images for App Catalog

This patch adds some logic around image handling.
Added images for app entries and details page.
Added image caching logic to store images on local disk.
Added Content-Cache header to cache images on client side too.

Change-Id: I34983311d3e53c54e00118609f5944f0971df507

commit_message:
Use debug level logging during unit tests

When unit tests fail we need to debug, so we should have debug level logging on.
We use fixtures FakeLogger during testing, to  enable debug logging pass
in log level as a parameter.
http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~python-fixtures/python-fixtures/trunk/view/head:/lib/fixtures/_fixtures/logger.py#L68

Change-Id: I70790aa39c0774726de71e5fa5751c45e7e34ffd

commit_message:
Fix debug message formatting in server_external_events

Hopefully this will be the last case of invalid debug log messages to
fix before turning on debug level log messages on during unit tests, so
we can gate on issues like this.

Change-Id: I8a2b64222deaf5320bcc2e5215b6bd46565a505f

commit_message:
Add host_routes property to Neutron subnet resource

Template snippet that was functionally tested:

subnet:
  Type: OS::Neutron::Subnet
  Properties:
    host_routes:
    - {destination: 192.168.1.0/24, nexthop: 192.168.1.2}
    network_id: {Ref: network}
    ip_version: 4
    cidr: 10.0.3.0/24
    allocation_pools:
    - {end: 10.0.3.150, start: 10.0.3.20}

(Next hop probably would make more sense to be in the CIDR)

Change-Id: I36f72f006a1ba48a6ed55a1c361b3df8d1359caa
Closes-Bug: #1250710

[{'created': '2014-03-07 00:10:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Convert dict to Instance object in compute manager

Currently, if a user takes a snapshot of a VM, stops nova-cpu
before the snapshot operation is finished, and restart nova-cpu:
nova-cpu will crash with the error:
AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'task_state'
This happens because _instance_update method returns a dict
and not an Instance object.

This patch fixes the issue by converting the dict to an
Instance object in the compute manager.

commit_message:
Use instance object instead of _instance_update()

Currently, if a user takes a snapshot of a VM, stops nova-cpu
before the snapshot operation is finished, and restart nova-cpu:
nova-cpu will crash with the error:
AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'task_state'
This happens because the _instance_update() method returns a dict
and not an Instance object.

This patch fixes the issue by not using _instance_update()
in the compute manager which is returning a dict and using
the instance object instead.

Change-Id: I3af0b09aeff7790b147a684f7c90af17d8ee7ae2
Closes-Bug: #1287945

    * This is a simple wrapper over the REST API, and is essentially

      output value updates from the server via cfn-signal
      (not yet implemented)
    * SoftwareDeployment will need to keep track of its deply state and
      go into CREATE_COMPLETE when the outputs have been received

', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2014-02-18 00:24:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Resource type implementation for software deployment

Some notes on the implementation:
  * SoftwareDeployment is a SignalResponder so that it can receive
    output value updates from the server via curl or cfn-signal
  * By default, SoftwareDeployment remains in an IN_PROGRESS state
    until a signal is received
  * If wait_for_signal=False the resource will go immediately to COMPLETE
  * A deployment resource can be configured to deploy on any action.
    By default it deploys on CREATE and UPDATE
  * The outputs deploy_stderr, deploy_stdout and deploy_status_code
    are defined in the attributes schema, but other attributes map to
    whatever outputs are defined for the corresponding config resource
  * The resource will go into a FAILED state if an error_output output
    has a value, or if deploy_status_code is non-zero

Implements: blueprint hot-software-config

Change-Id: I97df5651dc6f27ed4ddc7355c21ab61270b15b68

', 'number': 9}, {'created': '2014-02-25 21:26:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Resource type implementation for software deployment

Some notes on the implementation:
  * Whenever a config should be deployed, this resource loads the config
    and creates an ephemeral derived config which has the following inputs
    added to it:
    * deploy_server_id
    * deploy_action
    * deploy_signal_id
    These inputs can be used by the hook *or* by the configuration script
    itself.
  * The ephemeral config also has the current input values inserted into
    the 'value' field of the config inputs. This allows the deployment
    metadata to be a simple list of configs.
  * Subclasses of SoftwareDeployment can make further transformations to
    the ephemeral config, such as transforming the config script to contain
    input values.
  * SoftwareDeployment is a SignalResponder so that it can receive
    output value updates from the server via curl or cfn-signal
  * By default, SoftwareDeployment remains in an IN_PROGRESS state
    until a signal is received
  * If wait_for_signal=False the resource will go immediately to COMPLETE
  * A deployment resource can be configured to deploy on any action.
    By default it deploys on CREATE and UPDATE
  * The outputs deploy_stderr, deploy_stdout and deploy_status_code
    are defined in the attributes schema, but other attributes map to
    whatever outputs are defined for the corresponding config resource
  * The resource will go into a FAILED state if an error_output output
    has a value, or if deploy_status_code is non-zero

Implements: blueprint hot-software-config

Some notes on the implementation:
  * Whenever a config should be deployed, this resource loads the config
    and creates an ephemeral derived config which has the following inputs
    added to it:
    * deploy_server_id
    * deploy_action
    * deploy_signal_id
    * deploy_stack_id
    These inputs can be used by the hook *or* by the configuration script
    itself.
  * The ephemeral config also has the current input values inserted into
    the 'value' field of the config inputs. This allows the deployment
    metadata to be a simple list of configs.
  * Subclasses of SoftwareDeployment can make further transformations to
    the ephemeral config, such as transforming the config script to contain
    input values.
  * SoftwareDeployment is a SignalResponder so that it can receive
    output value updates from the server via curl or cfn-signal
  * By default, SoftwareDeployment remains in an IN_PROGRESS state
    until a signal is received

  * A deployment resource can be configured to deploy on any action.
    By default it deploys on CREATE and UPDATE
  * The outputs deploy_stderr, deploy_stdout and deploy_status_code
    are defined in the attributes schema, but other attributes map to
    whatever outputs are defined for the corresponding config resource
  * The resource will go into a FAILED state if an error_output output
    has a value, or if deploy_status_code is non-zero
  * If the 'name' property is set, this will set the 'name' property
    of the derived config, which will determine the sort order of configs
    returned when fetching a list of config metadata for a given server.
  * When an input_value is set where there is no corresponding config inputs
    schema entry, the derived config will add those input schemas to the
    derived input. This allows some templates to be more DRY.

commit_message:
Resource type implementation for software deployment

Some notes on the implementation:
  * Whenever a config should be deployed, this resource loads the config
    and creates an ephemeral derived config which has the following inputs
    added to it:
    * deploy_server_id
    * deploy_action
    * deploy_stack_id
    * deploy_resource_name
  * When signal_transport=CFN_SIGNAL, the folling input is added:
    * deploy_signal_id
  * When signal_transport=HEAT_SIGNAL, the folling inputs are added:
    * deploy_auth_url
    * deploy_username
    * deploy_password
    * deploy_project_id
    These inputs can be used by the hook *or* by the configuration script
    itself.
  * The ephemeral config also has the current input values inserted into
    the 'value' field of the config inputs. This allows the deployment
    metadata to be a simple list of configs.
  * Subclasses of SoftwareDeployment can make further transformations to
    the ephemeral config, such as transforming the config script to contain
    input values.
  * SoftwareDeployment is a SignalResponder so that it can receive
    output value updates from the server via curl or cfn-signal
  * By default, SoftwareDeployment remains in an IN_PROGRESS state
    until a signal is received
  * If wait_for_signal=False the resource will go immediately to COMPLETE
  * A deployment resource can be configured to deploy on any action.
    By default it deploys on CREATE and UPDATE
  * The outputs deploy_stderr, deploy_stdout and deploy_status_code
    are defined in the attributes schema, but other attributes map to
    whatever outputs are defined for the corresponding config resource
  * The resource will go into a FAILED state if an error_output output
    has a value, or if deploy_status_code is non-zero
  * If the 'name' property is set, this will set the 'name' property
    of the derived config, which will determine the sort order of configs
    returned when fetching a list of config metadata for a given server.
  * When an input_value is set where there is no corresponding config
    inputs schema entry, the derived config will add those input schemas
    to the derived input. This allows some templates to be more DRY.

Implements: blueprint hot-software-config

Change-Id: I97df5651dc6f27ed4ddc7355c21ab61270b15b68

commit_message:
Remove signal_id from deployments API and model

The same information is now available from the deployment's
derived config deploy_signal_id input value.

Other deployment signal transports might not have a single ID
to put in this field so it is better at this stage to remove
it from the deployments model and do anything that is required
using derived config inputs.

partial blueprint hot-software-config

Change-Id: I90c85d0ceb9fd67eed640c84348ef4175a6194b6

commit_message:
Document Assignments feature

The assignments feature allows admins to separate role authorization
and user authentication when the Identity Service is configured to
use an LDAP back end. This patch adds instructions on how to do so.

Change-Id: I46d6b090ae126b880003020dc0eb9112a44dabb0
Closes-Bug: #1290629

subject: Fix bad exception message output by %(message)s
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-05 06:54:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_exception.py', 'cinder/exception.py', 'cinder/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix bad exception message output by %(message)s

Since 'message' is the same name as the second argument to the
constructor, 'message="Oorah"' is not a keyword argument.

Bad example:
  raise exception.VolumeDriverException(message="Oorah")
  ==> cinder.exception.VolumeDriverException: Oorah

Good example:
  raise exception.VolumeDriverException(message="Oorah")
  ==> cinder.exception.VolumeDriverException: Volume driver reported
      an error: Oorah

In cinder/utils.py, it is using the invalid keyword arguments as
follows. It is not intended probably.

  raise exception.InvalidInput(message=msg)

It is usually 'reason=msg', but since messages would change, put
only 'msg'.

Change-Id: I563e6d01128a8d37e9d31826bcbec38f2fc7609c
Closes-Bug: #1288066
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix bad exception message output by %(message)s

Since 'message' is the same name as the second argument to the
constructor, 'message="Oorah"' is not a keyword argument.

Bad example:
  raise exception.VolumeDriverException(message="Oorah")
  ==> cinder.exception.VolumeDriverException: Oorah

Good example:
  raise exception.VolumeDriverException(message="Oorah")
  ==> cinder.exception.VolumeDriverException: Volume driver reported
      an error: Oorah

In cinder/utils.py, it is using the invalid keyword arguments as
follows. It is not intended probably.

  raise exception.InvalidInput(message=msg)

It is usually 'reason=msg', but since messages would change, put
only 'msg'.

Change-Id: I563e6d01128a8d37e9d31826bcbec38f2fc7609c
Closes-Bug: #1288066

Good news is it looks like the issue has been identified, the problem is
that we can't just fix it in Cinder, it needs fixed in OSLO, then synched again.

exposed adding this in this late in the release cycle.

Change-Id: I58a43c77e1adda52f9984203697e0ccf97cda235
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Sync latest Oslo config code for i18n"

This reverts commit 9550b6b6b486559b7c89b94e7ffb20b794aaa795

Hate to do this but this seems to be the culprit for exposing some issues:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1290503

Good news is it looks like the issue has been identified, the problem is
that we can't just fix it in Cinder, it needs fixed in OSLO, then synched again.

Also I'm not comfortable given all the hidden issues that this seems to have
exposed adding this in this late in the release cycle.

Change-Id: I58a43c77e1adda52f9984203697e0ccf97cda235

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-19 13:35:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adds nfs-server element

This patch adds an element that installs and configures nfs
services for testing the cinder nfs backend in an environment
where no nfs services are present (i.e. CI)

When added to an image, this element creates a directory at
/mnt/state/var/lib/nfs and shares it to the 192.0.2.0/24 subnet.

Change-Id: I4c425af64b866caa80b32b808e8a3b97d71ca81d
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-02-25 15:06:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adds nfs-server element

into a tablet, or the previous approach of copying the iptables
element (where a script adds entries to a file) should be the best
approach here.

commit_message:
Adds nfs-server element

This patch adds an element that installs and configures nfs
services for testing the cinder nfs backend in an environment
where no nfs services are present (e.g. CI)

When added to an image, this element creates a directory at
/mnt/state/var/lib/nfs and shares it to each node of the
overcloud.

This patch that handles the package mapping in diskimage-builder
needs to be applied first: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76398/.

Change-Id: I4c425af64b866caa80b32b808e8a3b97d71ca81d

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-03-10 09:22:03.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': 'Fix retry logic

When passing retry=True to verify_uuid_token this later should
re-call it self when the method fail and this time with retry=False.

Change-Id: I7e8f478e5116ac4119df134587f29f3f25ae8a42
Closes-Bug: #1285847
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix retry logic

When passing retry=True to verify_uuid_token this later should
re-call it self when the method fail and this time with retry=False.

Change-Id: I7e8f478e5116ac4119df134587f29f3f25ae8a42
Closes-Bug: #1285847

commit_message:
Increase testing of network connectivity

Adds ping against VM's internal network elements:
need all of them because agents might be located on different hosts
    1. Router port
    2. DHCP port

Adds ping against public network default gateway implying external
connectivity. Any further network tests are outside the Openstack cloud and the
testing environment

Partially Implements: blueprint neutron-advanced-scenarios

Change-Id: I9aaba5496581c9e3472d7a3846b1a0464f6334e6

subject: Give the seed and undercloud more IPs to work with
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-10 22:37:00.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_seed.sh', 'scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh'], 'message': 'Give the seed and undercloud more IPs to work with

We have a /24 range to work with, and would like to support seed
->overcloud for test performance. This requires enough IPs to
deploy the overcloud to be available on the seed.

Change-Id: I05a9d2fc70e10870b777590ea4841cc44c33f974
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Give the seed and undercloud more IPs to work with

We have a /24 range to work with, and would like to support seed
->overcloud for test performance. This requires enough IPs to
deploy the overcloud to be available on the seed.

Change-Id: I05a9d2fc70e10870b777590ea4841cc44c33f974

commit_message:
Add options to use remove_unused_* parameters

Being able to modify the parameters "remove_unused_base_images",
"remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds",
"remove_unused_kernels", "remove_unused_resized_minimum_age_seconds"
if desired.

Change-Id: Ia24594ccc4b999674456e59a279e2d5916cd5d7a
Implements: blueprint add-remove-unused-parameters

commit_message:
Log 'image_id' with all BadStoreURI error messages

- handle all BadStoreUri exceptions raised by 'legacy_parse_uri'
  function in
one location so that it becomes easier to log the error message with
'image_id'
- add tests for 'legacy_parse_uri'

Closes-Bug: #1243704

Change-Id: Ifc5de11832860ed51c1eb359d6f5cf78de8c0ba4

commit_message:
3PAR: Support extend volume based on snapshot

If extend volume fails with an HTTP Forbidden error 150,
convert the volume to a base volume and retry extending.

Change-Id: Id407058e954b2630f4a7f31c6149361301b502f2
Closes-Bug: #1285906

Add driver certificate test requirement

This provides a new driver requirement in passing certificate tests to
ensure tempest tests pass with actual backends.

subject: Revert "Sync latest Oslo config code for i18n"
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-10 22:22:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py', 'etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample', 'tools/conf/check_uptodate.sh', 'tools/conf/oslo.config.generator.rc', 'tools/config/generate_sample.sh', 'cinder/openstack/common/config/__init__.py', 'tools/config/oslo.config.generator.rc', 'cinder/openstack/common/__init__.py', 'run_tests.sh', 'tools/config/check_uptodate.sh', 'tools/conf/generate_sample.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Revert "Sync latest Oslo config code for i18n"

This reverts commit 9550b6b6b486559b7c89b94e7ffb20b794aaa795

Hate to do this but this seems to be the culprit for exposing some issues:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1290503

Good news is it looks like the issue has been identified, the problem is that we can't just fix it in Cinder, it needs fixed in OSLO, then synched again.  Also I'm not comfortable given all the hidden issues that this seems to have exposed adding this in this late in the release cycle.', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Sync latest Oslo config code for i18n"

This reverts commit 9550b6b6b486559b7c89b94e7ffb20b794aaa795

Hate to do this but this seems to be the culprit for exposing some issues:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1290503

Good news is it looks like the issue has been identified, the problem is that we can't just fix it in Cinder, it needs fixed in OSLO, then synched again.  Also I'm not comfortable given all the hidden issues that this seems to have exposed adding this in this late in the release cycle.

commit_message:
Create secret - case insensitive Content-Type check

Allows for upper case and mixed case types, subtypes, and parameters
in the Content-Type header field as per RFC 1341. More details can
be found at http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc1341/4_Content-Type.html.

Closes-Bug: #1252453
Change-Id: I400a05593e0c622de93a47a0fe0394793eb777f1

[{'created': '2014-02-24 02:23:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Sync latest Oslo config code for i18n

This sync pulls the latest Oslo config code over
to Cinder.  This sync is needed to include a fix
to config generator.  Config generator was failing
when lazy message translation was enabled.

The following changes are included with this patch. Each
patch includes the file(s) the patch touches:
-> c178e56 Add basic Python 3 tests
--> cinder/openstack/common/__init__.py
-> 12bcdb7 Remove vim header
--> cinder/openstack/common/__init__.py
-> 547ab34 Fix Copyright Headers - Rename LLC to Foundation
--> cinder/openstack/common/__init__.py
-> 44b6ea3 Import oslo.config configuration file generator
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/__init__.py
-> dd9aa2b Remove unused variables
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> 5dce17b Use entry points to discover options in libraries
--> tools/config/generate_sample.sh
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> e8e636c generator: add an EXTRA_LIBRARIES env variable
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> e3dddd7 generator: use EXTRA_* env vars in the bash script
--> tools/config/generate_sample.sh
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> 6da13e8 generator: rename EXTRA_MODULES_FILE to RC_FILE
--> tools/config/generate_sample.sh
-> 763eedf Fix DictOpt support in config sample generator
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> e839886 Config generator fails with lazy messages
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> 343686b Add check_uptodate to tools/config
--> tools/config/check_uptodate.sh

Oslo version:
-> 0f24d82 Fix migration.db_version when no tables
-> Date: Sat, 22 Feb 2014 00:32:18 +0000

Closes-Bug: 1280826
Related-bp: i18n-messages
Change-Id: I26a95fe96b08d6340b0fce1b9e2949c8e661a946

commit_message:
Sync latest Oslo config code for i18n

This sync pulls the latest Oslo config code over
to Cinder.  This sync is needed to include a fix
to config generator which is needed as part of
the work to enabled i18n messages.  Config generator
was failing when lazy message translation was enabled.

The following changes are included with this patch. Each
patch includes the file(s) the patch touches:
-> c178e56 Add basic Python 3 tests
--> cinder/openstack/common/__init__.py
-> 12bcdb7 Remove vim header
--> cinder/openstack/common/__init__.py
-> 547ab34 Fix Copyright Headers - Rename LLC to Foundation
--> cinder/openstack/common/__init__.py
-> 44b6ea3 Import oslo.config configuration file generator
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/__init__.py
-> dd9aa2b Remove unused variables
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> 5dce17b Use entry points to discover options in libraries
--> tools/config/generate_sample.sh
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> e8e636c generator: add an EXTRA_LIBRARIES env variable
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> e3dddd7 generator: use EXTRA_* env vars in the bash script
--> tools/config/generate_sample.sh
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> 6da13e8 generator: rename EXTRA_MODULES_FILE to RC_FILE
--> tools/config/generate_sample.sh
-> 763eedf Fix DictOpt support in config sample generator
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> e839886 Config generator fails with lazy messages
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> 343686b Add check_uptodate to tools/config
--> tools/config/check_uptodate.sh

Oslo version:
-> 0f24d82 Fix migration.db_version when no tables
-> Date: Sat, 22 Feb 2014 00:32:18 +0000

Change-Id: I26a95fe96b08d6340b0fce1b9e2949c8e661a946
Closes-Bug: 1280826
Related-bp: i18n-messages

commit_message:
Fix sqlachemy warning

This fixes the following warning:
SAWarning: Ignoring declarative-like tuple value of attribute timestamp:
possibly a copy-and-paste error with a comma left at the end of the line?

Change-Id: Ibda917862ffcc777d7c7d81f264e24e6511446fd
Fixes-Bug: #1286947

subject: Re-enable lazy translation
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-31 22:59:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Re-enable lazy translation

This patch re-enables lazy translation to enable REST API
responses to be translated to the requested locale (I.E. setting
'Accept-Language: zh-CN'.)

This patch also removes the unnecessary manual import of
'cinder.openstack.common.gettextutils _' in Cinder code.  Since _ is
still being imported in the cinder.openstack.common files from Oslo
we still need to set gettexttutils.enable_lazy().  enable_lazy will
be able to be removed once the manual imports of _ have been removed
from Oslo.

Change-Id: I0b5a35a2cc28d97d12ceccccd58565b487fef428
implements-bp: i18n-messages

This patch re-enables lazy translation to enable REST API
responses to be translated to the requested locale (I.E. setting
'Accept-Language: zh-CN'.)

Rather than attempt to add 'from cinder.openstack.common.gettextutils import _'
to all of Cinder's files at this point in time, I have instead decided to
cover both possible approaches by setting both 'gettextutils.enable_lazy()'
and 'gettextutils.install('cinder', Lazy=true) .'  This will ensure proper
functionality regardless of the approach taken by the developer.
Moving cinder to manually importing _() can be undertaken via another patch
if deemed appropriate.

commit_message:
Re-enable lazy translation

This patch re-enables lazy translation to enable REST API
responses to be translated to the requested locale (I.E. setting
'Accept-Language: zh-CN'.)

This patch also removes the unnecessary manual import of
'cinder.openstack.common.gettextutils _' in Cinder code.  Since _ is
still being imported in the cinder.openstack.common files from Oslo
we still need to set gettexttutils.enable_lazy().  enable_lazy will
be able to be removed once the manual imports of _ have been removed
from Oslo.

implements-bp: i18n-messages
Change-Id: I0b5a35a2cc28d97d12ceccccd58565b487fef428

commit_message:
Change lazy translation to retain complete dict

When replacement text was retained for later translation, only
the entries that were associated with the keywords in the
format string were retained.  There was a bug in how the keywords
were parsed.  This reduction was done to support the use of
locals() to specify the replacement text.  This is now prevented
by H501 (confirmed in all projects).

This means that instead of fixing the parsing code to correctly
find the keywords, the entire dictionary can now be retained
and the code for finding the keywords and stripping out unused
entries removed.

Change-Id: I7969dc20841d839f68b2ddb29ac47340c6b615e8
Closes-Bug: #1288049

[{'created': '2014-02-20 12:49:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adds nfs share metadata to block-storage template

To support the changes to the cinder element to allow the nfs
backend to be utilized, the nfs_shares key has been added.
The value is a list of strings containing share addresses.

This change is added as a WIP to facilitate an example to test
the cinder element change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/74563/

This patch hard codes the share address and needs to be updated to
match the actual address whether that is the control node or
another node.  Eventually this template will be changed to
reference the location of the share dynamically.

You may setup the nfs server manually or use the nfs-server
element (WIP) at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/74712/.
